loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a fridge, washing machine and TV.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three cows for his cattle-breeding business.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa earns a living through selling fish. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him sell his catch. Their fishing business has been running for 7 years. Adelfa and her husband work together to feed their kids and send them to school. She requested a loan to buy fishing nets, hooks, and other materials. This loan will help Adelfa and her husband continue their business.

Adelfa is 35 years old and has three children ages 14, 12 and 7. She hopes for her children to be God-fearing and respectful children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks, and other materials.

loans.name: Armelita

texts.en:
Armelita is 40-year-old married woman with three children. The oldest child is 13 years old. Armelita has a sari-sari store business. She sells various products like vinegar, salt, and soft drinks. She has requested a loan and plans to use it to buy more items to sell, such as rice and canned goods.

In the future, Armelita hopes for her business to grow and for her children to finish college and have bright futures

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en: Basilisa is 68 years old and married. She sells fish and runs a sari-sari store business. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him sell his catch at the market. Basilisa also manages their sari-sari store where she sells various products such as sugar and noodles. Basilisa earns about 5000 PHP per month from selling fish and running her store. She plans to use her loan to buy fishing nets, gears, and other items to sell such as spices and canned goods.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, gears, and other items to sell such as spices and canned goods.

loans.name: Corsina

texts.en:
Corsina is a 45-year-old married woman who lives in Talibon, Bohol with her family. Her husband is a fisherman.

Corsina is in the business of raising hogs. She and her husband built a small backyard piggery where she raises her pigs. Corsina sells the pigs at the market. She also helps her husband sell his catch to the people in her community.

Corsina plans to use her loan to buy pig feeds and fishing gears. She hopes for her family’s living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and fishing gears.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: Luciana is a 58-year-old married woman who lives in Talibon, Bohol with her family. She sells fish for a living. Her husband is a fisherman and the is the one who manages their fishing boat. Luciana sells all his catch at the market. Luciana has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other gear. She hopes for their business to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks, and other gear.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 31-year-old married woman living in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been running a rice farming business for 5 years. This business earns 5,000 PHP per month.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. 

In the future, Analyn hopes to improve her business and to earn bigger income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with three children. She plans to fund their education through the income that her loan provides.

Jocelyn is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 10 years. Jocelyn earns PhP 3,000 per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to buy a bigger farm to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Jo-Ann

texts.en:
Jo-ann is a 33-year-old married woman living in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur.

Jo-ann has been running a rice farming business for 5 years. This business earns 4,300 PHP per month. Jo-ann's loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. 

In the future, Jo-ann hopes to improve her business and to earn bigger income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Jonaliza

texts.en:
Jonaliza, is 33 years old and is a married woman living in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur.

She is engaged in farming and has been growing rice for 6 years. She sells her harvest at her town's local market. She plans to use her loan to purchase two bags of certified seeds, four bags of fertilizers, and other farm inputs. 

In the future, Jonaliza hopes to improve her business and to earn a bigger income for her family.

loans.use: to buy two bags of certified seeds, four bags of fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married woman with three children. She plans to fund their education through the income that her loan provides.

Delia is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. Delia has been growing rice for five years.  Delia earns PhP 2, 600 per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. In the future, Delia hopes to buy a bigger farm to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 41-year-old married woman living in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur.

She is a farmer and has been growing rice for 10 years. She earns 3,800 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month from doing this farming. She has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase four bags of fertilizers and pesticides. 
 
In the future, Emily hopes to have a bigger farm and an additional business for her family.

loans.use: to purchase four bags of fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is a married woman with three children. She plans to fund their education through the income that her loan provides.

Jeanette is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. Jeanette has been growing rice for eight years. Jeanette earns 4,300 Philippines pesos per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, Jeanette hopes to buy a bigger farm to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 34-year-old married woman living in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur.

Lilia has run a retail business for two years. This business earns 4,600 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. She also tills a small parcel of land where she grows rice. Some of the harvest is used for consumption and the rest is sold at the market.

This loan will be used to buy items to sell, such as shoes, clothes, and other ready-to-wear products.

In the future, Lilia hopes to improve her business and to earn a bigger income for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shoes, clothes, and other ready-to-wear products

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is 36 years old and a married woman living in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur.

Marianita is engaged in farming and has been growing rice for 5 years. She has a carabao that helps with tilling the land. She sells her harvest at her town's local market. Marianita earns 4,500 PHP per month from farming activities. She applied for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

In the future, Marianita hopes to improve her business and to earn a bigger income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a 45 year old married woman living in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She runs a rice farming business. She has been growing rice for 8 years. This business earns 4,300 PHP per month.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. 

In the future, Nena hopes to improve her business and to earn bigger income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with three children. She plans to fund their education through the income that her loan provides.

Teresita is a retailer in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. Teresita has been selling rice for 10  years. Teresita earns PHP 6000 per month from her business. 

This loan will be used to purchase 3 sacks of rice, 1 sack brown sugar, and ½ sack of white sugar to resell.
In the future, Teresita hopes to have a bigger business to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of rice, 1 sack brown sugar, and ½ sack of white sugar to resell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a 52-year-old married woman living in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur.  Violeta is a farmer and has been growing rice for 6 years. This business earns 4,600 PHP per month.

This loan will be used to purchase 4 bags of fertilizer and additional farm inputs. This will help Violeta improve her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase 4 bags of fertilizer and additional farm inputs

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 32-year-old married woman living in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. Juliet is a farmer. She has been growing rice for 10 years and earns 5,700 PHP per month from her business.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. 

In the future, Juliet hopes to improve her business and to earn a bigger income for her family. She also dreams of sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a 41-year-old married woman living in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. Tessie is engaged in farming and has been growing rice for 10 years. She sells her harvest at the market and earns about 3,700 PHP per month from doing this farming.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, 6 bags of fertilizer, and other farm inputs. In the future, Tessie hopes to buy a bigger farm to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, 6 bags of fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 39 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 18 years old.

Maribel has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 10 years. She sells items like noodles, detergent soap and soft drinks. She also makes rice cakes and other delicacies that she sells to the people in her community.

Maribel plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, soap and canned goods. She hopes to start another business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, soap and canned goods

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima has a fish-selling business. Her husband is a fisherman and is the one who operates their fishing boat. Zosima sells all his catch at her town's local market. She also grows seaweed to sell. Zosima works hard to help sustain her family. She requested a loan to buy fishing nets, hooks and other fishing gear.

Zosima is 59 years old and is a married woman with 2 children. She hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks and other fishing gear

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is an entrepreneur from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like canned sardines and tuna, detergent, soap and soft drinks to the people in her community. Belinda works hard to improve her business and support her family.

Belinda's loan will be used to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, rice and canned goods. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma, the owner of a sari-sari store for more than two years, sells items such as eggs and vegetables to the people of her community. Requesting a loan  to help improve her business, she will use it to buy more items to sell such as spices, eggs and soy sauce. Emma hopes to have a bigger store and more items to sell in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as spices, eggs and soy sauce.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita earns a living through selling fish. Her husband is a fisherman and is the one who manages their fishing boat. Esterlita sells his catch at their town's local market. She also provides tailoring services to the people in her community.

Esterlita works hard to help sustain their family and has requested a loan to purchase hooks, nets and other fishing materials. This loan will help Esterlita's husband catch more fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase hooks, nets and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Jorito

texts.en:
Jorito is a 32-year-old fisherman living in Talibon, Bohol. Jorito works hard to support his wife and seven children. He hopes to earn better and be able to sustain his children's education.

Jorito is asking for a loan to to buy hooks, nets and other fishing materials. This loan will help him catch more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy hooks, nets and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is engaged in fishing. Her husband is a fisherman and is the one who operates their fishing boat. Leonila sells all his catch at the market. She works hard to help sustain her family. 

She requested a loan to buy paint and gasoline for the pump boat (an outrigger canoe powered by a small engine). This will maintain Leonila's boat in a good condition.

In the future, Leonila hopes to expand their business by acquiring an additional pump boat.

loans.use: to buy paint and gasoline for the pump boat.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like fruits, vegetables and spices to the people in her community. 

She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, vinegar and vegetables. 

Lucita works hard to improve her business and living conditions. She hopes to have a bigger store and more items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, vinegar and vegetables.

loans.name: Ma. Nimfa

texts.en:
Ma. Nimfa is 30 years old and is a married woman with three children. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Ma. Nimfa has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for six years. She sells items like detergent. soap and shampoo to the people in her community. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as sugar and rice. 

She hopes for her business to be stable so that she can sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as sugar and rice.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a 26-year-old fisherman who lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with his family. He is married and has two young children. 

Noel works hard to provide the needs of his family. He also wants to save for his children's future. 

Noel requested a loan to repair his pump boat (an outrigger canoe with a small engine). This will help Noel continue his business and feed his family.

loans.use: to repair his pump boat.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 54 years old and is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 30 years old while the youngest is 20.

Cristina is a farmer working in Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She primarily grows rice to sell. She earns about $125 from doing this farming. She plans to use her loan to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She wishes for her family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 37 years old and married. She is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. She primarily grows rice to sell. Gemma raises her pigs in her backyard. She plans to use her loan to buy piglets, pig feed and farm supplies. Gemma works hard to support her family. She hopes to have an abundant harvest. She also hopes to expand her piggery in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets, pig feed and farm supplies

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a 57-year-old farmer who lives in the town of Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has six children.

Gilda primarily grows rice to sell. She works hard to keep her crops healthy. She requested a loan to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Gilda hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
35-year-old Linda earns a living through farming. She tills her own land where she grows rice crops to sell. She earns about $150 per month from doing this farming. Her loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Linda works hard to support her family. She has five children, the oldest of whom is only 12 years old. Linda hopes for her children to have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina is 42 years old and is a married woman with two children aged 16 and 10. She and her husband are both farmers. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Lucina's husband mainly manages their rice farm, while Lucina raises pigs to help augment their income.

Lucina's loan will be used to buy fertilizers and feeds. She hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and feeds.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is an entrepreneur from Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has two kids.

Nenita is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She has a small backyard piggery where she raises pigs. Nenita plans to use her loan to buy piglets, feeds and farm fertilizers. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. She also plans to expand her piggery in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds and farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 47 years old and is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is 23 years old. Her husband is a farmer.

Florenda has been in the hog-raising business for three years. She built a backyard piggery to raise pigs. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market. She also helps her husband grow rice crops.

This loan will be used to buy piglets, feeds, vitamins and farm fertilizers. She hopes for this loan to help her piggery and her husband's farm.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds, vitamins and farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Jerrylin

texts.en:
Jerrylin is 33 years old and is a married woman with three children. Her oldest child is 15 years old. Her husband is a farmer.

Jerrylin has been in the hog-raising business for eight years. She plans to use her loan to buy three piglets and three sacks of feed. She earns about $75 a month from this hog-raising business. She also helps her husband grow rice crops when she can.

She hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and three sacks of feed.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly is a hard-working father of three young children. He is 31 years old and married.

Jolly is a farmer working in San Jose, Agusan Del Sur. He grows rice and vegetables to sell. He also raises pigs in his backyard. He does his best to improve his earnings for his family. He requested a loan to buy farm fertilizers, piglets and feeds. He hopes to be successful in sending his children to school.

loans.use: to buy farm fertilizers, piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Ma. Erlene

texts.en:
Ma. Erlene is 43 years old and is a married woman with five children. The oldest child is 14 years old.

Ma. Erlene is a farmer who primarily grows rice to sell. She earns about $175 per month doing this farming. She requested a loan to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes for her business to grow and enable her to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lomas De San Pedro (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Lomas De San Pedro se reúne cada quince días en el sitio las Palmas del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos han mejorado sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Sonia, tiene 36 años, hace varios años su esposo falleció y de esa relación tiene tres  hijos de 16, 10 y 9 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y los dos menores en escuela. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta porque en otros lugares los intereses son más altos.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, esto le ha servido para sacar adelante a sus hijos después de la partida de su querido esposo, ahora con los créditos espera mejorar su negocio y su vida familiar.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Lomas De San Pedro [The Hills of San Pedro] meets every two weeks at Las Palmas of the Montecristi Canton, known for its rich precolonial culture, its handicraft which enjoys a national and international reputation, and the famous Panama hats. 

This is a group of people who decided to get together and form this communal bank which is of such value to them, since they have used the loans to improve their small businesses. They work in various types of business such as commerce, services, and food sales among others. 

Here we meet Mrs. Sonia, 36, whose husband died some years ago. From that relationship she has three children who are 16, 10 and 9 years of age. The eldest is in high school and the two younger children in elementary school. This is her first loan with the communal bank. She is the group's president and she likes it because in other places the interest rates are higher. 

She has a grocery store in her home where she sells all kinds of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, etc. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. and sometimes until later. Her children help her with the work. She has had this business for a year and it is going very well. This has allowed her to support her children since her dear husband's departure. With the loans she hopes to improve her business and her family life. 

She will use this loan to further stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other staple items. 

Her goals are to continue on in her business and that her store would grow more and more.

loans.use:
to purchase rice, sugar, detergents, cold cuts and other staples. 

Comprar arroz, azúcar, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad.

loans.name: Ximena Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Cesario Reyes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ximena, tiene 25 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen un  hijo de dos años  de edad. Su esposo esta en el extranjero. Ella estudia ingeniería en Marketing en la Universidad Laica de la ciudad de Manta.

Es una gran madre que comparte su tiempo entre el estudio, el cuidado de su pequeño hijo y el comercio ya que se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, en las mañanas recorre la ciudad visitando a sus clientes, también vende a sus compañeras de la universidad donde estudia.  Nos cuenta que  sus clientes le realizan muchos pedidos. Trabaja todos los días en las mañanas y en las noches en la universidad. Deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días. Tiene cuatro  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos, es la secretaria del mismo y le gusta por los beneficios que entrega la institución.
 
Sus sueños son terminar  sus estudios y ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
The José Cesario Reyes community bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton which is known for its rich pre-colonial architecture and its handicrafts which are famous both nationally and internationally.  It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

Here we meet 25 year-old Ximena who is married and has a two year-old son.  Her husband is abroad.  Ximena is studying marketing engineering at Laica University, in the city of Manta.

Ximena is a great mother who divides her time between her studies, looking after her young son and her business selling all types of clothes.  She makes her sales door to door.  In the mornings, she travels round the city visiting her customers.  She also sells to her fellow students at university.  She tells us that her customers make a lot of orders with her.  She works every morning and studies at the university every evening.  She leaves her goods with her customers on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil every two weeks.  Ximena has been in this business for four years and it is going very well.

Ximena will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.  She has been a member of her community bank for three loan cycles and is the bank's secretary.  She likes it a lot because of the benefits that the institution provides.

Ximena's dreams are to complete her studies and become a great businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Ramon de 45 años de edad es contratista de obras, esta casado con la señora Jorgelina de 27 años, quien es ama de casa, la pareja tiene dos hijos, un varón de 2 años y una niña de 8 meses. 
Ramon comenta que se había iniciado como ayudante albañil trabajando con su padre hace mas de 20 años actualmente, trabaja por su cuenta, el mismo se encarga de las obras que realiza como revoques y  pinturas de pared, construcción de viviendas, baño, cocina, colocación de azulejos, pisos y otros.
Solicita ayuda crediticia a Fundación Paraguaya para comprar una mezcladora ya que con uno solo no puede cumplir con todos los compromisos que tiene.
Agradece desde ya por la confianza otorgada de poder solicitar el préstamo a Kiva, ya que con esa ayuda podría cumplir a cabalidad las obras y así tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Ramon, 45, is a Contractor.  He’s married to Jorgelina, 27, who is a housewife.  They have two children: a 2-year-old boy and an 8-month-old girl.

Ramon comments that he had started out as a bricklayer’s assistant working with his father over 20 years ago.  He currently works for himself.  He is in charge of the jobs he does like plastering, whitewashing and painting, building houses, bathrooms, kitchens, installing tile, flooring and others.

He is asking Fundación Paraguaya for financial help to buy a cement mixer because with just one he can’t keep all his commitments.

He already is grateful for the trust placed in him allowing him to request a Kiva loan because with this help he will be able to completely finish his jobs and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: Ana Julissa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Cesario Reyes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 28 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres. Es licenciada en publicidad y mercadotecnia. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por dos  ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ha podido ir aumentando su pequeño negocio.

Es una mujer muy emprendedora que no solo se conforma con un sueldo sino que busca siempre mejorar su situación, ella trabaja de secretaria en la Notaria Publica De Montecristi pero también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, nos cuenta que sale en las noches una vez que haya terminado sus horas laborables en su trabajo, aunque comenta que allí también tiene clientes a quienes les deja mercadería. Deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días. Tiene cuatro  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

Su sueño es tener una gran boutique.
texts.en:
The José Cesario Reyes community bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which are recognized on both a national and international level.  It is also known for its famous Panama hats.

Here we meet Ana, who is 28 years old and lives in her parent's house.  She has a degree in advertising and marketing.  She has been a member of the community bank for two cycles and she likes it because she can improve her small business with the loans.

She is an enterprising woman who is not only content with a salary, but is always looking to improve her situation.  She works as a secretary at the Notary Public of Montecristi, but she also sells clothing of all types.  She sells door to door.  She goes out at night after her work hours have ended, although she also has customers for whom she leaves merchandise.  She offers credit to her customers and collects payments every fifteen days.  She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil every fifteen days.  She has been doing this work for four years and it is going very well.  

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

Her dream is to have a large boutique.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Cesario Reyes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro  hijos ya todos mayores de edad. Su esposo es maestro en un colegio en la  ciudad de Manta.

Ella comparte su tiempo entre su trabajo y su negocio ya que ella es maestra de una escuela en la ciudad de Montecristi pero también se dedica al comercio en lo que es venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días por semana recorriendo la ciudad pero casi todos los días ella ofrece sus productos en la escuela donde imparte sus conocimientos tanto a sus compañeras como también a madres de familia que llegan hasta este centro de estudios. Deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Lleva cinco años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos ciclos y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The José Cesario Reyes community bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which are recognized on both a national and international level. It is also known for its famous Panama hats.

Here we meet Ana, who is 52 years old, married, and has four adult children.  Her husband is a teacher in a high school in the city of Manta.

She divides her time between her job and her business.  She is a teacher in a school in the city of Montecristi, but she also has a business selling all types of clothing.  She sells door to door.  She works three days a week, traveling through the city, but every day she offers her products at the school, where she teaches her skills to her colleagues and also to the mothers who come to the school.  She offers credit to her customers, and she collects payment every fifteen days.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to.  She has been doing this work for five years and it is going very well.

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.  She has been in the community bank for two cycles and she likes the ease of getting loans.  

Her dream is to have a large store where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Comité se formo gracias a la señora Emilia, quien habia integrado otro comité anteriormente, el cual se disolvió.
Ella decidió invitar a sus amigas y vecinas a conformar un nuevo grupo. Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el segundo ciclo del programa de la Fundación Paraguaya, son 15 integrantes quienes invierten en distintas actividades, como por ejemplo la señora Andrea, quien es la Presidenta del grupo, ella tiene 21 años, está acompañada por el señor Amalio, quien se dedica a la albañileria, ellos tienen un hijo y ella invierte sus ganancias en la compra de productos varios al por mayor para su venta porterior.
Es una mujer muy sacrificada a pesar de su juventud, al no alcanzarle el dinero para adquirir la cantidad de productos que necesita para el comercio solicita el crédito a Kiva, para que pueda realizar las compras de sus mercaderías a fin de venderlos en mejores cantidades y calidades.
texts.en:
The committee came together thanks to Emilia who had started a different committee previously but it disbanded.  She decided to invite her friends and neighbors to form a new group.  Currently, the committee is in its second cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s program.  It has 15 members who invest in different activities like Andrea, who is group President.

She is 21 years old and is lives with Amalio who is a Bricklayer.  They have a son and she invests her profits buying various goods at wholesale to later resell.

She is a very longsuffering woman despite her youth.  At not having enough money to buy the quantity of products she needs for commerce she asked for a Kiva loan to buy her merchandise in order to sell them in better quantities and quality.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies, personal hygiene supplies, towels, etc.

loans.name: Holalla Dominga

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Cesario Reyes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Holalla, tiene 56 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos ya todos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido trabaja en la liga cantonal en el cuidado del estadio.

Es una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a realizar trabajos de artesanía, ella elabora flores a base de telas, vestidos para muñecas de adornos y compra canastas de mimbre sin pintar y  les decora en diversos colores. Lleva todos sus productos una vez por semana hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil a entregar a distintos bazares que le compran toda su mercadería. Trabaja todos los días y nos cuenta que lleva realizando esta actividad por más de 20 años y que le gusta lo que hace ya que con esto promociona el arte.

Este crédito es para comprar más canastas, pinturas, telas y materia prima para todos los productos que elabora. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta porque con los créditos le han ayudado en muchos momentos difíciles que ha tenido.

Su sueño es tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The José Cesario Reyes communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its art and crafts, famous both nationally and internationally.  This is the place known for the straw “Panama” hats.

Here we meet Holalla, 56, who is in a communal marriage and has three children, all now adults.  Her husband works in maintenance of the stadium for the league of the canton.

She is a wonderful housekeeper and to get money for expenses she produces handicrafts.   Holalla makes cloth flowers, doll dresses and she buys unpainted wicker baskets to decorate in many colors.  Once a  week she takes her products to Guayaquil and delivers them to stores who buy all her merchandise.  She works every day and tells us that she has been doing this for more than 20 years.  She enjoys what she does and thus promotes her art.

Holalla will use the loan to buy more baskets, paints, fabric and supplies for all the items that she makes.  She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and is its president.  She likes the bank because the loans have helped her in many of the difficult periods that she has had.

Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: To buy baskets, paints, fabric and supplies to produce handicrafts

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las emprendedoras Santa Lucía se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Juana contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, se encuentran ya en el 7° ciclo.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
La presidenta, la sra. Juana se dedica a la venta de chipas por las calles de su ciudad, pues es un panificado típico de su país muy consumido en cualquier punto de Paraguay.
Ella aprendió a realizar este producto con ayuda de su madre y lo ha vuelto en su medio de ingresos.
Hoy día ella desea poder aumentar la economia de su familia, por eso solicita ayuda crediticia para poder comprar mas insumos para la preparacion de chipas.
texts.en:
This excellent group of women from the city of Itá is called “Las Emprendedoras Santa Lucía” and they came together thanks to Juana who contacted an advisor during a weekly meeting she was conducting in the area to find out about the working methodology of the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women’s Committee).  They are now in their 7th cycle.

They all carry out fund raising activities and help each other to reach the common goals they all have within their group and with Fundación Paraguaya.

The President, Irma, sells “chipás” throughout the streets in her city.  It is a typical bread consumed everywhere in Paraguay.  She learned how to make this product with help from her mother and she’s turned this skill into her source of income.

Today, she’d like to increase her family’s income so is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients to make chipás.

loans.use: to buy cheese and starch.

loans.name: Maribel Isabel

texts.es:
La Señorita. Maribel es socia del banco comunal Prosperidad, vive por el sector del Batan en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su arquitectura y su naturaleza. Cuenca es cuna de deportistas y escritores, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señorita. Maribel tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres que es propia y con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, su papá es de profesión mecánico y su mamá es comerciante.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Avon, Yanbal, actividad que la realiza hace un año y medio, vende recorriendo la ciudad a sus amigas y conocidas, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

Este es su primer crédito que lo realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por su tío. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir  en la compra de perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería para seguir con su negocio.

Su meta es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the village bank Prosperidad. She lives in the sector of Batan in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its beautiful architecture and for the natural surroundings. Cuenca is the cradle of sportsmen and writers, and its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Maribel is 18 years old, single and lives with her parents in their home. She shares the family's living expenses. Her father is a mechanic and her mother is a merchant.

She sells Avon and Yanbal brand cosmetics, an activity that she's been doing for a year and a half. She goes around the city selling to her friends and acquaintances. She works every day without a set schedule.

This is her first loan from the village bank, which she joined at the invitation of her ungle. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and costume jewelry so she can grow her business.

Her goal is to expand her business more.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and costume jewelry

loans.name: Elsa Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Elsa es socia del banco comunal Prosperidad, vive por el sector del Batan en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su arquitectura y su naturaleza. Cuenca es cuna de deportistas y escritores, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora Elsa tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 14, 12, 7, 4 y 2 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y los dos siguientes en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como agente vendedor, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Elsa labora en un restaurante que es de su propiedad, esta actividad la desempeña hace un año y medio, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.
 
En el banco comunal esta hace 2 años y los créditos anteriores le han permitido crecer poco a poco en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de vajilla y mesas que le hacen falta para su restaurante.

Su sueño es  tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the village bank Prosperidad. She lives in the sector of Batan in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its beautiful architecture and its natural surroundings. Cuenca is the cradle of athletes and writers, and its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Elsa, 34, is married and has 5 children ages 14,12,7,4, and 2. Her oldest daughter is in high school and the next two are in a school in the city. Her husband works as a sales agent. They don't own a home, so they rent.

For a year and a half, Elsa has worked in her own restaurant. She works every day from 8am until 8pm.

She has been in the village bank for 2 years and her previous loans have allowed her to expand her business little by little. The new loan will be invested in the purchase of dishes and tables which her restaurant lacks.

Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy dishes and tables.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana  es socia del banco comunal Prosperidad, vive por el sector de los Totems en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su arquitectura y su naturaleza. Cuenca es cuna de deportistas y escritores, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
Doña Ana tiene 60 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, casados e independiente. Su esposo le ayuda en casa ya que se encuentra jubilado, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Ana labora en la costura, actividad que la desempeña hace 30 años, se dedica a coser  ropa deportiva y lencería, labora de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo.

En el banco comunal está en su crédito numero 20 y lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima como telas e hilos. 

Su meta es comprar más máquinas para agrandar su taller.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the village bank Prosperidad. She lives in the Totems sector on the city of Cuenca, which is known for its beautiful architecture and the natural surroundings. Cuenca is a cradle of athletes and writers, and its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Ana, 60, is married and has four grown children who are married and independent. Her husband is retired and helps her around the house. They own their home.

Ana has been a seamstress for 30 years. She sews athletic clothing and lingerie. She works Monday to Friday without a set schedule.

This is her 20th loan with the village bank and she will invest it in the purchase of basic materials like fabric and threads. 

Her goal is to buy more sewing machines to expand her workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La Señora Nancy es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a la costura, elaboración de porta joyas, sábanas, crochet, en fin realiza varios elementos con la confección.
Es una señora muy creativa y sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus trabajos. 
Ella tiene 4 hijos y su marido es Guardia de Seguridad, por lo que mutuamente se ayudan con los gastos del hogar.
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo.
La señora Nancy solicita el crédito para la compra de mas materiales que necesita para su costura, en especial de telas e hilos.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) committee was formed when several neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso came together.  The members form a much unified group capable of carrying out activities together that strengthen their companionship.

Nancy is one of the group members.  She is a Seamstress and makes jewel cases, sheets, crochets; in reality, all sorts of sewn items.  She is a very creative woman and her customers are quite impressed with her work.

She has four children and her husband is a Security Guard so they help each other meet household expenses.

She is very satisfied with her work and with the training the group gets.  Nancy is asking for the loan to buy more materials she needs for her sewing, especially fabric and thread.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El comite tiene por nombre "Rosa Mistica" en honor a la virgen Maria, quien es la santa patrona de este grupo.
Todas las integrantes son mujeres muy sacrificadas que desean prosperar cada día junto con sus familias, y asi poder obtener una mejor calidad de vida que les ayude a vivir dignamente.
La sra. Guillermina es una de las integrantes más activas del comité, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas en un puesto que posee de manera alquilada, porque no puede conseguir su propio local.
Se dedica a este tipo de comercio pues le ha ayudado bastante en el sostenimiento economico de su familia y la fruta es un producto de consumo diario, por eso sus clientes van aumentando en cantidad.
El desafío que tiene ultimamente es que no puede abastecer la demanda de sus clientes, por eso solicita el credito, para poder comprar frutas a mayores escalas cuantitativas y poder venderlos a la clientela que suministra.
texts.en:
The committe named, "Rosa Mistica" (Mystic Rose), in honor of the virgen Mary who is the patron saint of the group.  All of the members are women who have had to give up a lot but wish to get ahead alongside their families and have a better quality of life that can allow them to live with dignity.  Guillermina is one of the most active members of the group; she sells fruits at a rented location because she has been unable to obtain her own spot.
She dedicates herself to this business since it has helped her economically support her family.  Fruit is a product of daily consumption which is why her customer base is increasing.  Her current challenge is that she has not been able to fulfill her client's demand which is why she is requesting the loan, in order to purchase fruit in greater quantities and sell them to the customers she supplies.

loans.use: to purchase citric fruits for resell ( grapefruit, oranjes, lemons, mandarines, etc)

loans.name: Sector Los Olivos (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Sector Los Olivos está formado por 6 mujeres y dos hombres, quienes trabajan en diferentes actividades para  mejorar la economía de sus hogares. Son personas trabajadoras y siempre ven lo positivo de la vida. Viven por el sector del Carmen de Guzho, lugar en donde la mayoría de su gente labora en la agricultura o cría de animales, algunos también tienen sus negocios propios y muchos salen a laborar en diferentes actividades en la ciudad de Cuenca. 

La Señora. Nancy  vive en la comunidad del Carmen de Guzho, tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 8, 7, 4, 2 años y su ultimo hijo de apenas 3 meses de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es chofer y labora conduciendo maquinaria pesada, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña Nancy labora en una guardería, actividad que la realiza por que le gustan los niños y este trabajo también le permite cuidar de sus hijos, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su suegra. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar con esta actividad.

Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados. 

Los niños de la foto son hijos de algunas de las socias.
texts.en:
The “Sector Los Olivos” (Olives Sector) Communal Bank is formed of 6 women and 2 men who work in different activities to better their own household economies. They are hard-working people and always look at the positives in life. They live in the Carmen de Guzho sector, where the majority of people work in agriculture and livestock raising. Some also have their own stores, while many go out to work in different activities in the city of Cuenca.

Nancy lives in the community of Carmen de Guzho, is 29 years old, married, and has 5 children, aged 8, 7, 4, 2, and a baby of 3 months. Her 2 eldest children attend a little primary school in the city. Nancy's husband is a chauffeur and works driving heavy machinery. By means of their jobs, they have managed to build their own house.

Nancy works in a children's nursery, an activity she does because she loves children. This work permits her to care for her own children. She works from Monday through Friday from 8:00 am until 4:00 pm.

This is Nancy's first loan from the communal bank and she was invited to join by her sister-in-law. The money will be used to buy chickens so she can begin chicken raising. Her goal is to finish her house, which still needs some work.

The children in the photo belong to some of the members.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Ñemity Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la zona Yhakarosa de la ciudad de Caacupé. Son mujeres muy activas, con muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante.
Las señoras están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya, porque gracias al crédito de etapas anteriores y a las constantes capacitaciones que reciben, aprendieron a ahorrar, pueden hacer crecer su negocio, y logran ayudar al sustento de sus familias.
La Sra. Juana es la tesorera del comité, es una mujer muy activa, siempre busca la forma de incentivar a sus compañeras a trabajar y salir adelante, ella posee una granja donde cría todo tipo de animales, y planta todo tipo de hortalizas. Vive con su hijo quien le ayuda en su trabajo.
Hoy día solicita el crédito para poder comprar insumos para el area de la agricultura especialmente, como fertilizantes, semillas, fumigadoras, etc., pues han aumentado las demandas de hortalizas y desea poder proveer de dichos vegetales a los clientes.
El comité ya está trabajando con la fundación hace aproximadamente 3 a 4 años.
texts.en:
The women of this committee are from the Yhakarosa zone of Caacupe city. They are active women who are motivated to work hard and improve their lives. 

The women are thankful for the Paraguaya Foundation because thanks to previous loans and regular trainings they have received they have learned to save money, grow their businesses, and provide for their families.

Mrs. Juana is the treasurer of the committee. She is an energetic woman and she always looks for ways to encourage her fellow members to work hard. She owns a farm where she raises a variety of animals and grows vegetables. She lives with her son who helps her with the farm. She applied for a loan to purchase agricultural supplies like fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides because there has been an increased demand for vegetables and she hopes to provide enough produce for her clients. The committee has been working with the foundation for between three and four years.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 48 years old and married with 3 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a food production business in the Philippines for 12 years. Victoria has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. In the future, Victoria  would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 57-year-old married woman living in the village of Nagbukel San Isidro. She has four children and all of them have their own families already. She is grateful because her business is improving.

She earns about PHP 20,000 every time she sells 12 hogs every three months. Teresita does her best in order to maintain her hog raising business. According to her, the profits she generated were used in the maintenance of her fishpond. She also used some amount for their daily needs. Teresita has been in the business for two years and still she would like to develop it. Because she doesn't have enough capital for her fattening hogs, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 18,000. She plans to use this loan to purchase feed, supplies and vaccine for the hogs and some will be used to maintain her fishpond.

In the future, Teresita hopes to buy additional fingerlings and produce more piglets so that she can improve their way of living and save for security purposes when they get weak.

loans.use: to buy feed, supplies and vaccine

loans.name: 041017 - Giang Son - Hoang Truong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hong operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Hong has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Hong is 23 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of an eight-member group, the 041017 - Giang Son - Hoang Truong solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2010, Hong joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profits, Hong hopes to maintain a successful business, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng làm nghề đánh cá từ năm 2008, trưởng nhóm kiếm được 2.000.000 đồng trên tháng từ hoạt động kinh doanh của mình.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en: Leonor is a 58-year-old married woman living in Libag Sur, Tuguegarao City. She has five children. Leonor's spouse works as a tricycle driver. Leonor has been in the business of hog fattening and breeding for six years and she earns about 7,000 monthly. She is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000. She plans to use this loan to purchase additional piglets to raise and buy vitamins and medicines to ensure good nutrition. She has been a client of ASKI for five years. In the future, Leonor would like to make frequent sales and consistent profits to meet their needs at home.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, vitamins and medicines

loans.name: 040910 - Lien Minh - Hoang Truong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Liên is 33 years old and she is married with 2 children..
Liên is the group leader of the 040910 - Lien Minh - H. T. solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 
Liên lives with 2 dependents in H. Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Liên has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Liên has been involved in this business for 5 years.
The main harship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Liên hopes to maintain  a successful business, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: Chị Hoàng Thị Liên có thu nhập 3.000.000 đồng trên 1 tháng từ công việc kinh doanh của mình. Đây là công việc kinh doanh chính và mang lại thu nhập khá ổn định cho chị.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 48-year-old mother blessed with three school-aged children. Elizabeth is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 4,000 per month. 

Elizabeth is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional breeding livestock and livestock feed. She has been raising hogs for almost three years.

In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve this kind of business to raise more pigs and earn income to support the education of their children and to improve their living status. She hopes that she can take more loans from the Kiva lenders in order to strengthen the business she manages and give her children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional breeding pigs and feed

location.town: Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is from the village of Bura, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 59 years old. Beverly is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Beverly owns & operates a business buying and selling dried fish & tuba (the native term for coconut wine). Beverly has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Beverly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beverly is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional stocks of dried fish & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Beverly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more coco wine from the village and sell it for profit.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 58 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells slippers and shoes. She has had this business for 15 years. Lilian's spouse raises hogs. Lilian is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase more shoes and slippers in different sizes including sandals to offer. Each month, Lilian earns about PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. 

In the future, Lilian hopes to have a big business in order to generate more income that would help to improve their living condition.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes, slippers and sandals to sell

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is a married woman with three children. She is 51 years old and has had a food selling business for six years. Carolina sells fruits and vegetables to the people in her community. She has been in this business for six years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase additional vegetables to sell, such as cabbages, tomatoes, squash and onions that would help to increase the capacity of sales for her business. In the future, Carolina hopes to have a big business and increase her income to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell such as cabbages, tomatoes, squash and onions.

loans.name: Rona Lorraine

texts.en:
Rona Lorraine is single and 30 years old. She has a general store where she sells rice, oil, different kinds of groceries such as noodles, biscuits, shampoo, soap, canned goods, milk, coffee and many kinds of dry goods. Rona Lorraine has had this business for almost eight years. According to her, the items that are easily disposed of are the rice, oil, coffee, milk, ingredients and eggs because all these are the basic needs.

Rona Lorraine is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy additional rice, cooking ingredients, milk, oil and eggs. She is grateful for the development of her retail store. She usually earns about PHP 12,000 each month in this kind of business. 

In the future, Rona Lorraine hopes to improve her business by buying additional products needed in her village and to save some of her profit to have some savings when she gets weak.

loans.use: to buy additional rice, cooking ingredients, milk, oil and eggs to sell

loans.name: Veleria

texts.en:
Veleria is now 56 years old and widowed with nine adult-aged children. Veleria is a hog raiser and a farmer working in the Philippines who earns PHP 5,000 per month. 

Veleria is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase breeding livestock and feed. She has been raising hogs for almost six years.

In the future, Veleria hopes to raise more pigs and earn more income to satisfy their daily basic needs and to save more funds for their future. She believes that she can improve this kind of business through financial assistance from the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. To earn a living, she is engaged in buying and selling different kinds of fish. She earns about PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. Elizabeth has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell. Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI for three years.  In the future, Elizabeth would like to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.en:
Diomedes is a 48-year-old married man living in the village of Nagbukel San Isidro, Isabela. Diomedes has two children. Diomedes' spouse works as a housekeeper.

He earns about PHP 2,000 per month in his shop where he repairs washing machines and other kinds of electronic appliances. Diomedes has been in the business for nine years. According to him, he plans to use this loan to buy new materials needed in his repair shop such as scissors, tape and other spare parts. He hopes to continually develop his business through his hard work and patience. He said that his last loan was really helpful and he really needs more assistance from the KIVA lenders. 

In the future, Diomedes hopes that his request loan will be approved.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for his repair shop such as scissors, tape and other spare parts

loans.name: 05.04.03-Phong Mỹ- Hoằng  Phong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyết operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Tuyết supports no dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. The main hardship that Tuyết faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is 36 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 05.04.03-Phong Mỹ-Hoằng Phong solidarity group. 

This is Tuyết's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profits, she hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fishes and shrimps.

loans.name: 02.04.04 - Xuan Phu - Hoang Phu Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan works in agriculture growing food. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Loan is 45 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a nine-member group, the 02.04.04 - Xuan Phu - Hoang Phu solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. In the future, Loan hopes to maintain a successful business, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transporting his farm products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two seats  for the barber shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 29-year-old hardworking man who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the produce business for three years, and with the income, he has been able to construct a house and support his parents. His hardship is high electricity charges, and his dream is owning a food store. Robert needs the loan to buy maize and coffee for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize and coffee for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a 32-year-old single mother of two children. She rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in second-hand clothes for 11 years, and with the income generated, she has been able to pay school fees. Her hardship is lack of enough capital, and her vision is to own a boutique plus buying a plot of land and building a house. Evelyne needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en: Emmy is a 32-year-old married man with two children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in photography for 12 years. He started with a salon and saved enough to start his current business. His hardship is fraudulent workers, and his vision is a bigger studio with a printing machine, plus educating his children. Emmy intends to use the loan to buy wedding gowns and a camera.

loans.use: to buy wedding gowns and a camera.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Shem

texts.en: Shem is a 30-year-old married man with two children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for eight years, and with this business, he has been able to pay school fees and complete building his house. His hardship is the high price of commodities, and his vision is to have a wholesale business. Shem needs the money to buy sugar and rice for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice for resale.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok has been in the farming business for over ten years, frequently working alongside her husband in the farm field. They earn an average profit of $3.25 a day to cover their financial expenses. In order to increase their income, Sok is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase a used motorbike for her husband to run a motor taxi service.

The couple is blessed with two young children. This photo was taken inside their house with their children.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorbike for her husband to run a motor taxi service.

loans.name: Kiima

texts.en: Kiima is a 32-year-old married man with two children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the photo-studio business for 10 years, in which he started with two million shillings and now has five million shillings as working capital. His hardship is competition with other people in the same business, and his vision is buying a printing machine for colored photographs plus educating his children. Kiima needs the loan to buy wedding gowns for rental.

loans.use: to buy wedding gowns for rental.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four bundles of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is 46 and married with five children. The oldest is 17. Her husband works as a farmer. Analiza is also a farmer. She and her husband till a plot of land in San Jose, Agusan del sur. They have been growing rice for 9 years. Analiza has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. She hopes to be able to have her children finish schooling.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en:
Chhen, 53 years old, and her husband, Meas, 70 years old, are both in the photo above. This couple plants rice on their own farmland and they also sell many kinds of goods in front of their house. The family typically generates a revenue of US $3 each day.

The couple has five children; three are single and two are married. Three of their children are employed in various jobs. One of their children will be married soon and Chhen does not have enough money for the party. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to add to her current savings to hold a wedding party for her son.

loans.use: to hold a wedding party for her son.

loans.name: Lama

texts.ar: لما في عمر 26 سنة هي امراة متزوجة وام لولدان تعمل في بيع المواد الغذائية والادوات المنزلية لها في عملها نحو 8 سنوات تحب عكملها وتعتمد على نفسها في دعم عائلتها واولادها فهي تعيل عائلتها وتحب ان تؤمن لهم دائما العيش الكريم والتعليم الجيد تريد ان تزيد من مدخولها من خلال تحسين وضع المحل فهي تعاني من نقص في البضاعة الموجودة لديها وتعاني من منافسة في محيطها تسعى الى التطور والتقدم في العمل تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للمحل مواد غذائية تتميز بالسعر الجيد والتنوع بالبضاعة تحلم بأن تمتلك محل يضم عدد كبير من البضاعة هي امراة مجتهدة محبة للعمل لا توجد لديها صعوبات في العمل سوى النقص في المادة التي تعيق تطوير المصلحة لها زبائن من محيطها وجيرانها
texts.en: Lama is a 26-year-old wife and mother of two who is very self-reliant in providing her children with a decent upbringing. For the past 8 years she has been selling an array of foodstuffs and domestic cleaning supplies to her neighbors and fellow townsmen at very reasonable prices. Lama is a very serious worker, although her inventory is somewhat low and her competition is fierce. Accordingly, she was interested in obtaining a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase foodstuffs for her store.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for her market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: 47.thieu Chinh Group

texts.en: Mrs. Ha has worked in agriculture farming poultry and cattle for the past three years. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Ha is 28 years old and married with no children or dependents. She is the group leader of the 10.5.47.Thieu Chinh solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. The main problem that Ha faces in her business is lack of capital. This is Ha's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, she hopes to maintain a successful business and remodel her house.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock more beans to sell.

loans.name: 44. Thiệu Dương Thiệu Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nghi works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Nghi is 53 years old and she is married with two children. Nghi is the group leader of the 9.6.44 Thieu Duong solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Nghi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nghi has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nghi has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Nghi faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nghi hopes to maintain  a successful business, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي رجل متزوج عمره 56 سنة وهو اب لثلاث اولاد يعمل في معمل لتجارة الباطون والحديد له في عمله 10 سنوات لديه خبرة اسعة في عمله ويحب ان يطوره وان يزيد من مدخوله ومدخول عائلته وان يطور العمل بشكل دائم فهو طموح محب للعمل ويسعى الى التطور لأن ما يميزه هو العمل الجيد وانه مقصود في محيطه العملي ولكن ما يعيق سوى المادة في زيادة المدخول وتطوير العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى زيادة دعائم الحديد لديه خاصة انه في منطقة تطلب التعمير والتجديد المنازل بشكل مستمر وما لديه من دعائم غير كاف حتى يطور عمله ويزيد من عدد زبائنه له خبرة كبيرة في العمل ولا توجد صعوبات لديه وهو يمتلك العديد من المعدات واللوازم والمعدات الحديثة
texts.en: Ali is 56 years old and married with three children. He has ten years of experience working at a concrete and steel factory, work which he is very passionate about and which he is always trying to further develop. He is sought after by companies who need concrete and steel products. Although Ali does own several state-of-the-art pieces of equipment, he nevertheless is in need of a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase more steel supports in order to meet the demand for the prolific construction going on in his area.

loans.use: to purchase steel supports for his construction supplies business.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice sells greens. She is 22 years old, married, with two children, one of whom goes to school.  Joice has requested a loan to stock more greens to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with her extra profits.

loans.use: Stock more greens to sell.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, he has operated a carpentry business, selling in a shop to his neighbours and passersby. Silas faces a major challenge in the high cost of transporting charcoal and high competition from other carpentry operators. He dreams of expanding his workshop in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 he wants to purchase wood, gum and timber for his carpentry business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood, gum and timber for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 37 years old and married to John who contributes to the family income. She has been running her grocery store for a period of about four years with an income of about 13,100 Kenya shillings a month. 


This is her first loan from KADET and she wants to use it to start a beauty shop as a secondary income-generating project. She hopes to have a leading beauty salon in the area and give her children quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To start a beauty shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock more millet to sell.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel has been selling used clothes in Naivasha for the last 14 years. He is 37 years old, married to Mary and they have one child.

Joel was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan. He repaid his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy used clothes to sell in bulk. He wants to buy a variety of clothes (men’s, women's and children’s). In the future, Joel hopes to move into a more permanent shop and to start selling new clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 28 years old.  She is married and has 4 children, 2 of them go to school.  Rose sells bread to earn income.  She borrowed a loan to stock more bread to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more bread to sell

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ar: حسن في عمر 27 سنة متزوج وهو اب لأربعة اولاد يعمل كسائق كاميون وكمبروسور مازوت له في عمله 7 سنوات لديه خبرة في هذا العمل ولكنه يعاني من بعض المشاكل المادية التي تقف حاجز في وجه تطور عمله حيث انه يريد ومن خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى صيانة الكاميون خاصته وتكملة دعم البناء من خلال شراء دعائم حديد للمنزل يسعى الى زيادة مدخوله حتى يتمكن من تحسين وضعه المادي والاجتماعي ومساعدة اولاده في التعليم وزيادة المدخول هو يتميز بالعمل الجيد وحب العمل بشكل مميز حيث ان لديه زبائن في محيط قريته وخاصة في نقل المازوت للمنازل يجد صعوبة في تطوير عمله من خلال نقص الامكانيات ولكنه يطمح بأن يصبح ذات مستوى مميز بالمدخول والعمل
texts.en: Hasan is a 27-year-old husband and father of four who strives to give his children a good education. For the past seven years, he has been transporting diesel oil to homes with his truck and portable diesel compressor. Hasan is very good at what he does, although he suffers from low capital. Accordingly, he wanted to ask Al Majmoua for a loan to have maintenance done on his truck and to buy some steel supports to finish the construction of his personal home.

loans.use: to have maintenance done on his truck which he uses for work and to finish the construction of his home.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 35 years old.  She is married and has 6 children, 3 of them go to school.  Rose sells bread.  She has borrowed aloan to stock more bread to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits earned.

loans.use: stock more bread to sell

loans.name: Mary Lyn

texts.en:
Mary Lyn is now 31 years old and married with four school-aged children. Mary Lyn is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 5,000 per month. 

Mary Lyn is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. She grows rice and has been doing it for almost eight years.
