In the future, Mary Lyn hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to earn more income to support the education of their children. She hopes that Kiva lenders will continuously assist her in the business to strengthen the source of their income and give their children a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

location.town: Brgy. San Fabian, Kayapa, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 24 years old.  She is married and has 1 child.  Stella sells bread.  She borrowed a loan to stock more bread to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more bread to sell

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Chhem lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She is a rice cultivator, earning an income of around $1.50 a day to help support the family expenses. Her husband helps her in the rice-planting business. Chhem also does casual work for additional income.

The couple has three children, two of whom are studying in public school and are still dependent on their parents' income. Chhem will be using her loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting. Chhem and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives on her own. She has owned a small grocery store since 2009. She is new in this type of business. She purchases her products from locA. traders and sells them directly to her customers. She obtained her first Kiva loan and has been a very good client with punctuA. payments. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her store’s inventory. She hopes that with the loan help, she will be able to increase her income because she is planning to hire a full time employee and needs to be capable of paying his salary and all the other expenses.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ar: حفيظه امرأة متزوجة وهي ام لثلاث اولاد تعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية والاولية لها في هذا العمل اكثر من سنة تحب عملها وتريد من خلاله الاعتماد على الذات والتكفل في دفع تكاليف تعليم الاولاد وزيادة مدخول لعائلة ولكنها تعرض لنقص في المدخول ورأس المال وهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى تقوية عملها من خلال شراء بضاعة جديدة للمحل وتطويره وتكبيره وصيانته هي امراة طموحة تحب ان تعتمد على ذاتها في مواجهة الحياة الاقتصادية الصعبة ييتميز بالعمل الدائم والاسعار الجيدة لها طموح بأن تصبح ذات مكانة كبيرة في المجتمع وصاحبة محل كبير يضم جميع انواع المواد الغذائية والاولية
texts.en: Hafiza is a wife and mother of three who, through relying on herself, works to pay her children’s tuition and to further augment the family’s income. For the past year, she has been working at a market selling foodstuffs at very reasonable prices. Hafiza is very driven to overcome these hard economic times and to one day emerge a prominent women in her community with a large store. In the meantime, she wanted to ask Al Majmoua for a loan to purchase more inventory and further expand and renovate her store.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her market and further expand and renovate her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 29 years old.  She is married and has 6 childdren, 4 of them go to school.  Mary sells fish.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and pay labor fees

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 51-year-old married man living with his wife and four young children. Some of his children are still attending school. He is from Lebanon. He has been involved in the agriculture field for the past 30 years. In 1992, he started running his own farm. He cultivates all types of fruits and vegetables according to the season, in addition to cultivating olives. He uses plastic tents to monitor his product quality better during the year. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase spices and seeds for his farming work.  He estimates that with the coming harvesting, his sales will be increased and therefore his income. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase spices and seeds for his farming work

loans.name: Rebulon

texts.en:
Rebulon is a 51-year-old farmer who lives with his wife Yokebet and 3 children –  22-year-old Yalon is currently studying at the University, 17-year-old Robet is in the 1st grade of junior high school, and 11-year-old Stevanus is in the 6th grade of elementary school. 

Although Rebulon has his own plot of land to farm, he also buys crops such as coconuts, bananas, soursops, sweet potatoes and cassavas from other farmers and then resell them in the market. He has been involved in this business for almost 2 years. Previously, he sold only the crops from his farm.   

As the father of 3 children, Rebulon works hard in order to fulfill his family's needs as well as pay for the educational cost for his children.  His son Yalon needs much money while studying at the University, so Rebulon wants to increase his income from his business. Rebulon would like to purchase more agricultural  products from other farmers in his village to increase his sales, but unfortunately he does not have enough capital to do so.  Therefore, he is seeking for a loan to make his dream come true. 

Rebulon met a TLM Field officer who introduced him to the TLM lending programs. Rebulon thinks that he should take this opportunity to improve his business for the future. He has requested a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM.   He would like to spend the loan to buy crops such as bananas, coconuts, vegetables, etc. in large quantity. Rebulon is really expecting that TLM will approve his loan application.

loans.use: buy fruits & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Janifer

texts.en: Janifer is 35 years old.  She is married and has 5 children, 3 of them go to school.  Manifer sells charcoal.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: 46.thieu Duong Group

texts.en:
Dung is the group leader of the 9.1.46.Thieu Duong solidarity group, which consists of 7 members.   She is 37 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.  

Dung works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.  She has been involved in this business for 8 years.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

In 2010, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.   The main harship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Dung hopes to maintain a successful business and to remodel her house.  She hopes for her business to do well.

loans.use: buy baby livestock and fruit

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 62-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three children. Two of the children are still attending school. He has been working as a farmer since 1990 and has 35 years of experience in this occupation. He cultivates all types of vegetables and distributes his products to multiple agriculturA. markets. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and has been an excellent client with payments on time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a car to help him with his products distribution. He intends to expand his business operation into other areas in order to get higher profits and support his family better.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.ar: محمد عمره 53 سنة يعمل في حدادة وصيانة السيارات له في عمله 15سنة هو متزوج ووالد لخمسة اولاد يتميز بالدقة في العمل والخبرة الواسعة في هذا المجال يريد ان يطور نفسه وعمله وان يؤمن مستقبل جيد لأولاده يسعى الى زيادة المدخول وتحسين الوضع المادي يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة وعدة جديدة للمصلحة يسعى الى تطوير العمل دائما ولكن تواجهه بعض الصعوبات المادية ونقص في رأس المال له خبرة كبيرة وزبائن من محيطه وهذا ما يتطلب منه ان يطور العدة لزيادة الطلب
texts.en: Mohamad is a 53-year-old husband and father of five who strives to better himself and advance his family. For the past 15 years, he has been working in automobile maintenance and body work, a job to which he brings great experience and thoroughness. Nevertheless, in order to be able to bring in more customers from his local community, he wanted to ask Al Majmoua for a loan to purchase some new parts and equipment for the shop.

loans.use: to purchase new parts and equipment for his automobile maintenance shop.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 38 years old and is a single mother of 3 school-aged children, all of whom attend school. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years in her hometown of Nkubu in eastern Kenya. Her mixed farm produces maize, beans, bananas and milk, which are all sold locally. 

Lucy has made a loan request of 30,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo in order to buy chickens and chicken feeds and to construct a chicken house. She believes that by venturing into poultry farming her income will increase and she will be able to cater for her family's basic needs. 

Lucy says that her major concern and worry is that she might not have enough funds to buy chicken feeds and this might pose a challenge to her production. She aspires to acquire another piece of land that will enable her to expand her farming business in the future.

loans.use: To puchase chickens & chicken feeds and construct a chicken house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his education fees.

loans.name: Chido Group

texts.en:
Lawson is a 58-year-old married man living in the town of Masvingo. He has two children aged 12 and 19, both are attending school. 

Lawson has been running a general store selling groceries and alcohol for five years. He employs five people. He says the main challenges his business faces are financial problems.

Lawson has requested a loan of $400 to buy more groceries. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will improve the welfare of his family.  Lawson sees himself as a wholesaler within the next 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is 39 years old.  She is married and has 7 children, all of them go to school.  Joice sells charcoal.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Adonai Plus Group

texts.en:
Bernadette, aged 46, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Adonai Plus”. It is composed of 13 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Bernadette has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1992. She runs a restaurant. Her business is located to the western part of Kinshasa. She has been a faithful Hope client, having seven times obtained and properly repaid loans. Since then, her business has prospered.The loan she’ll obtain next will be used to diversify her business by purchasing 80 crates of soft drink for resale with the goal of increasing her profits. 

Her business generates a profit of about $25 per day. Bernadette’s ambition is to become a soft drink provider in her environment. She is married and the mother of three children whose ages vary between 18 and 32 years old. Two of them attend school

loans.use: to diversify her business by purchasing 80 crates of soft drinks for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Yousra

texts.ar: يسرى عمرها 30 سنة تعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية والاولية لها في عملها 15 سنة تعمل بجد ونشاط وهي تعتمد على ذاتها في تكوين المستقبل وزيادة الدخل ورأس المال هي نشيطة ومحبة للعمل تريد من خلال المجموعة ان تؤمن مستقبل جيد من خلال تطوير عملها وذلك بشراء بضاعة جديدة موسمية مثلجات ومعلبات يتميز عملها بقربه من مناطق سكنية وقريبة الى اهل منطقتها وهي تتميز بالاسعار الجيدة والبضاعة الجديدة هي طموحة تحب ان تمتلك محل اكبر يضم الكثير من البضاعة التي تخولها ان تستوعب عدد اكبر من الزبائن وهي تسعى الى ان تممتلك منزل خاص بها من خلال تطوير عملها وتأمين مستقبل جيد لها وان تساعد اهلها في الحياة الاقتصادية الصعبة
texts.en: Yousra is 30 years old and works in a grocery store. She has been doing this for 15 years and is hard-working and enthusiastic. She depends on herself to increase her income, plan for the future and provide the necessary capital for the business. She loves her business and with this loan she wants to develop her business by purchasing new seasonal stock as well as frozen and canned produce. Her business is distinguished for its proximity to residential areas, for her good prices and up to date stock. She is ambitious and wants to own a larger store that can stock more goods and in turn attract a larger number of customers. She aspires to be able to have her own house, secure her future and and assist her family through their financial difficulties.

loans.use: to develop her business by purchasing new stock as well as frozen and canned produce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Mrs. Run is 40 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham province, where she earns a living by planting a few crops on her own land. On average, she earns a profit of around $1.50 a day to support her family’s needs. Mrs. Run is married with six children; five of them have already started new families and the last one is married. Her husband, Mr. Soun, also works on the farm. Mrs. Run has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, HKL, in order to rent some of the neighbor’s land to enlarge her crop plantation and to buy insecticides, fertilizers, and potato seeds for planting. Mrs. Run and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: to rent some of the neighbor’s land to enlarge her crop plantation and to buy insecticides, fertilizers, and potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock more greens to sell.

loans.name: Thoi's Group

texts.en:
Thoi is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is N. Xá 1 - Nhóm 18 (18).

Thoi  is married and has 4 school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily chickens, for sale. Thoi has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,200,000 VND a month from it.

In 2007, Thoi joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thoi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Thoi's 4th loan from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees and to buy ducks.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thoi  0 (0) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Thoi  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là N. Xá 1 - Nhóm 18 (18).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  Thoi  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thoi  kiếm được khoảng 3.200.000 VND.  Vào 2007, Thoi  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thoi  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 0,007 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Huề  là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế như sắt vụn.


2.  Vân là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi lợn và trồng lúa.


3.  Hiển là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi lợn.


4.  Hương là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm như trứng gà, trứng vịt.


5.  Thực là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ quản lý chất thải.


6.  Hương là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm như gạo, đỗ, lạc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel, 35 years of age, is married, and blessed with three children. He has been growing corn for almost 15 years. At the last cropping, he earned 7,000 PHP. He's asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides for his corn farm. He hopes to continue to take loans and achieve his dreams for his children through patience and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase additional stock of chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Dince

texts.en:
Dince is 36 years old.  She is married to Marselinus, a 47-year-old man who is working as a consultant in Atapupu. They have been blessed with four children:  Yaya who is 17 years old and is in the 2nd grade of senior high school, Angelita who is 11 years old and is in the 6th grade of elementary school, Giovani who is 7 years old and is in the 2nd grade of elementary school, and Yolanda who is four months old.

Dince operates a kiosk business to provide an additional source of income for her family. Her husband cannot send all his income home as he also needs money for his living. Dince has been running her kiosk business for one year. 

With a small amount of capital, Dince started her kiosk business by purchasing products such as rice, cooking oil, soap, detergent, cigarettes, etc.  In addition to running her kiosk business, Dince also loves to cultivate bitter melon. It takes three months to harvest, then she sells them at Oesao Market.

Dince feels that through this business she can support her children's daily needs and education, as she is able to earn more income. She plans to buy 2 display windows to put stock in and also more inventory.  She is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. She hopes that TLM is willing to assist her by providing the loan.

loans.use: purchase 2 display windows and more stocks

loans.name: Ikram

texts.ar: اكرام امراة متزوجة وعمرها 62 سنة وهي ام لأربعة اولاد تعمل في بيع الخبز والمناقيش لها في عملها سنتين تحب عملها وترى انها تواجه حياة اقتصادية صعبة فهي امراة مجتهدة وتحب ان تعتمد على نفسها في تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي لها ولعائلتها فهي تعاني من صعوبات مادية تقف حاجز دون تأمين حاجاتها الاجتماعية ومساعدة اولادها في تخطي الظروف الاجتماعية الصعبة تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء عجانة ومكنة رقاقة لخبز المناقيش والخبز حتى تتمكن من تحسين وتطوير عملها لتتمكن من زيادة رأس المال لديها وتطوير حياتها المادية هي نشيطة وتسعى الى عدم الاحتياج والطلب من احد فهي ذات اخلاق وحب للذات ما يخولها ان تعتمد على نفسها وتخطي الظروف المادية الصعبة
texts.en: Ikram is a 62 year old married woman with 4 children. She works in a bakery selling bread and pastries. She has had her business for 2 years and loves it. She feels that she struggles financially, though she is a hardworking woman and likes to depend on herself to to improve her and her family's social and financial situation. She suffers from financial problems which prevent her from fulfilling basic social needs, including helping her children overcome their difficulties. With this loan she wants to purchase a new bread making machine so that she can improve and develop her business and improve her financial situation. She is enthusiastic and aspires to be without need or without dependency on anyone. She is a loving and moral person who likes to depend on herself to overcome financial difficulties.

loans.use: to improve her financial situation and buy a new breadmaking machine for her bakery.

loans.name: Takunda Agrodealers Association Group

texts.en:
Samuel is a 51-year-old married man living in the town of Masvingo. He has five children ranging in age from 13 to 21 years old, all of them are attending school. He also cares for two additional dependents.

Samuel has been running a grocery and furniture outlet for fifteen years.  This is his primary source of income. He says that lately the main challenge he faces is the lack of working capital. Farming also provides him an additional source of income.

Samuel has requested a loan of $400 to increase his stock of furniture and groceries. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will help him improve his family’s living standards and enable him to educate his children.

Samuel envisions opening more outlets in the future and increasing his number of workers employed within the next 5 years, should the economy remain stable.

loans.use: increase his stock of furniture and groceries

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a single woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 5 years, Faith has been operating a beauty salon business.  She works in a shop, providing services to her neighbours and passersby.  The main challenges she faces in her business are high costs of transportation and seasonality.  She dreams of expanding her beauty salon business in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 40,000, Faith wants to purchase hair chemicals, cosmetics, weaves and wigs. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: purchase hair chemicals, cosmetics, weaves and wigs

loans.name: Manal

texts.ar: منال امراة متزوجة وام لولدان تعمل في بيع الألبسة والاحذية الاوروبية المستعملة هي امراة نشيطة محبة للعمل وتريد ان تساعد زوجها في تخطي الظروف الاقتصادية الصعبة والاعتماد على الذات هي امراة محبة للعمل وتريد ان تكون رأس مال جيد حتى تتمكن من تأمين العيش الجيد لأولادها وتحسين ظروف العمل تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة موسمية مستعملة واحذية تسعى الى تطوير المصلحة حتى تتمكن من تخطي الظروف المادية الصعبة كان للقرض السابق الأثر الكبير في تطوير العمل وكانت تلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة تمتلك مهارات تريد توظيفها في تحسين الظروف المادية والاقتصادية
texts.en: Manal is a married mother of 2 children. She works selling second hand European clothes and shoes. She is an active woman who loves her business. She wants to help her husband overcome financial difficulties and be independent, and to attain enough income to be able to improve her business and secure a good standard of living for her children. With this loan she wants to purchase more second hand stock. She is skillful and wants to work in better financial and economic conditions. Her previous loan helped develop her business greatly and she had the full support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand clothes and shoes for her store and improve her business.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo, 45 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. He has been growing corn for almost 25 years. At the last cropping, his net income was 8,000 PHP. He's asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. He would like to maintain his relationship with Kiva lenders to request larger loans in the future so that he can grow his corn farm productively.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is 38 years old.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom go to school.  Margret sells tomatoes and onions.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more tomatoes and onions to sell.  She hopes to construct a concrete house in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is a married woman with 3 children, 2 of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 3 years, Zubeda has been operating a restaurant business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also sells Kikoi's to contribute another source of income to her livelihood.  She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With this loan for Kshs 40,000, Zebeda wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for her restaurant business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Kasem

texts.ar: قاسم شاب اعزب في مكتمل العمر عمره 25 سنة يعمل في تربية المواشي وبيع الحليب له في عمله 5 سنوات حيث انه تعلمه من والده وهو يعمل بجد ونشاط حتى يؤمن العيش الكريم والمستقبل الجيد له ولعائلته وحتى لا يترك قريته فهو يساعد والده في تخطي الظروف المادية الصعبة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مواشي جديدة حتى يتمكن من زيادة رأس المال لديه وتطوير وتكبير المصلحة هو انسان نشيط محب للعمل وللتطور يسعى الى امتلاك عدد اكبر من المواشي ليتمكن من بيعها والمتجارة بها فهو يمتلك القدرة على زيادة رأس ماله وتطوير عمله لا توجد لديه سوى بعض الصعوبات المادية الت يتعيق تطور عمله والاعتماد على نفسه في مساعدة عمله واهله له زبائن من محيطه من المزارعين والتجار الذين يقصدونه لتميزه بالاهتمام بالمواشي وتربيته بشكل نظيف واهتمام كبير
texts.en: Kasem is 25 years old and unmarried. He works in raising livestock and selling milk and has been doing this for five years; he learned the trade from his father. He is hard working and enthusiastic and wants to secure a good standard of living and future for himself and his family without leaving his village as he assists his father financially. With this loan he wants to purchase more livestock so that he can increase his capital and expand his business. He is an active individual who loves his work. He aspires to own more livestock and engage in selling animals. He has the capability to to achieve all of this, the only obstacle he faces is lack of capital which is preventing the development of his business and his self-dependency. He has local customers from amongst the farmers and businessmen who single him out because of his dedication to his animals and the hygienic way in which he raises them.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock and expand his business.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan, age 29, lives in the province of Kompong Cham, the best territory for farming. Her husband frequently works in the farm fields alongside her. Chan has a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother, growing various crops in both rainy and dry seasons.

The coming rainfall is good for Chan's crop; however, she doesn’t have enough capital to farm. She is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers and planting sugar cane. She is blessed with one child.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to plant sugar cane.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 35 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, both of whom go to school.  Monica sells salt and sugar.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more salt and sugar to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more salt and sugar to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 30 years old.  She is married and has 6 children, all of whom go to school.  Mary sells alcohol.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more alcohol to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is married to a businessman.  They own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 2 years, Nuru has been operating a business selling Kikoi’s and hand bags. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With this loan for Kshs 20,000, Nuru wants to purchase bundles of Kikoi’s and hand bags for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy Kikoi’s and hand bags

loans.name: Karim

texts.ar: كريم شاب عمره 28 سنة متزوج واب لولدان يعمل في بيع وغيار الزيت للسيارات وغسيل السيارات له في عمله 11 سنة يحب العمل ويسعى الى تطويره وزيادة مدخوله وتحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي له ولعائلته هو طموح محب للعمل ويسعى الى زيادة رأس المال في العمل وتأمين سبل الحياة الكريمة لأولاده هو طموح يتميز بالعمل الجيد والتطور الدائم والاسعار الجيدة يتميز عمله بالانفراد في قريته ولكن ما يعيق تحسينه هو نقص في رأس المال فهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى زيادة البضاعة من خلال شراء بضاعة جديدة للمحل زيوت ومعدات للعمل كان للقرض السابق من المجموعة الاثر الجيد حيث ان تاريخه جيد مع المجموعة وكان يلقى دائما الدعم من العائلة يتميز بالمصداقية وحب التحسين في الوضع المادي والاجتماعي
texts.en: Karim is 28 years old and married with two children. He works selling car oils and cleaning products and has been doing this for 11 years. He loves his business and aspires to develop it and thereby increase his income improving his and his family's financial and social circumstances. He is ambitious and wants to secure a good standard of living for his children. He is known for his good services, up to date business outlook and competitive prices. His business is unique in his local area, but what holds him back is lack of financial capital. With this loan he wants to purchase more stock such as oils and equipment. The last loan had a positive impact on is business and he has good credit history with the company.

loans.use: to buy new stock for his auto parts store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 30 years old.  She is married and has 6 children, 4 of whom go to school.  Susan sells sugar.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more sugar to sell.  She hopes to open a big shop in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more sugar to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 36 years old. She is married and has 4 children, 2 of whom go to school. Susan sells clothes and has borrowed a loan to stock more clothes to sell. She hopes to pay her children's schooling in the future with the extra profits from the business.

loans.use: stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more Khangas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy ladies clothes, fabrics and cosmetics

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Mrs. Hout, age 32, is married with one child who attends school. She has been a local farmer for years. She and husband earn additional income by running a small vehicle washing business inside her home. She provides this service to her neighbors and other travelers. Her husband also repairs motors.

Mrs. Hout usually generates a profit of around $5 a day to meet her family's needs. She is seeking a loan to buy two cows to assist her in the field. Since cows can also be used for breeding purposes, the couple can raise the offspring.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is 30 years old.  She is married and has 3 children, 2 of whom go to school.  Joice sells rice and sorghum and has borrowed a loan to stock more rice and sorghum to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more rice and sorghum

loans.name: Okari

texts.en:
Okari has a mixed farm in the outskirts of Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for 6 years now and sells his milk and eggs to the local market. Farming has been his only source of income.

Okari has requested a loan of 35,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to buy additional stock of chickens and chicken feeds. He believes that this will increase his production and he will be able to earn more income. The extra income from this project will enable him to pay school fees for his three children who are in school now. He plans to have 3000 chickens in the next 5 years and be the main supplier of eggs to the local market.

Okari is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children between 2 and 8 years old.

loans.use: buy chickens and chicken feeds

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has three children, two of whom are attending school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past 4 years, Esther has been operating a business selling Kikoi clothing.  In addition, she also sells charcoal as another source of income.  Her major challenge is the high cost of transporting charcoal in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 40,000, Esther she wants to purchase bundles of Kikois and sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy kikoi clothing and charcoal

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 40 years old.  She is married and has 5 children, 4 of whom go to school.  Grace sells cakes and has borrowed a loan to stock more cakes to sell.  She hopes to pay school fees for her children with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: stock more cakes to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a Ugandan male aged 41 years who needs a loan to pay labourers to weed his banana plantation.  He hails from Kyenjojo district and is a father of nine children aged between 16 and 2 years.  He dreams of educating his children and setting up other income generating activities to supplement his earnings. A farmer of 20 years, he acquired his start up capital from accumulated savings from his government job.

loans.use: pay labourers to weed his banana plantation

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 38 years old.  She is married and has 5 children, 3 of them go to school.  Rose sells food in a restaurant and has borrowed a loan to stock more food to sell.  She hopes to pay her children's school fees with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: stock more food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a weighing machine

loans.name: Chab

texts.en: Chab is a 35 year-old woman who lives with her family members in a small house in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She does housework in her neighbor’s house, earning approximately US $1 each day. Her husband works in construction. Chab has requested a loan to purchase a second motorcycle for her husband to ride to work and to run a motor taxi part-time. The couple has three single children, all of whom are studying in a local school.

loans.use: to purchase a second motorcycle for her husband to ride to work and to run a motor taxi part-time.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 35 years old.  She is married and has 7 children, all of them go to school.  Betty sells cassava flour and has borrowed a loan to stock more cassava flour to sell.  She hopes to construct a concrete house in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: buy cassava flour

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer is 40 years old.  She is married and has 5 children, 3 of whom go to school.  Jenifer sells cakes and has borrowed a loan to stock more cakes to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more cakes to sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok, a single mother of one child who works as a taxi driver, lives in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap. She was married years ago, but divorced her husband. To earn a living, she sells fresh fish to people in the market. Mrs. Sok will be using her loan to buy more fish for resale, and will use the profits to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Namik

texts.ru:
Namik yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Namik 44 qoda. 
Uje 5 let kak on zanimayetsya perevozkoy stoitelnix materialov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya pochinki svoyey mashini dlya toqo chtobi perevozit stroitelniye materiali i tem samim obespechit svoyu semyu.
texts.en:
Namik is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. He is married and has two children.  Namik is 44 years old.
 
For five years, he has been transporting building materials.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy parts to repair his truck, which he needs to transport construction materials and to support his family.

loans.use: to buy repair parts for his truck.

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en: Mrs. Chheang and her husband, Ghib, both 42 years old, reside in Kompong Cham province. This couple has been married for many years but they still have no children. They earn a living by planting various crops on their own farmland. Mrs. Chheang currently plants bean and potato crops, which she will harvest and sell when they are mature. The couple earns a profit of about $3 a day. As this is the rainy season, Mrs. Chheang doesn’t have the funds to plant her crop. She decided to seek a loan to rent a plowing machine and to buy potato seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to protect her crop.

loans.use: to rent a plowing machine and to buy potato seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Tafara Agrodealers Association Group

texts.en:
Wilfred is a 46-year-old married man living in the town of Masvingo. He has three children ranging in age from 10 to 22 years old, two of them are currently  attending school. He also cares for three dependents.

Wilfred has been running a general store that sells a wide variety of products as well as operating a restaurant. Both businesses have been in operation for seven years.  He main challenges he faces are competition and low capital.  These businesses are his only sources of income.    

Wilfred has requested a loan of $400 to boost the working capital for his restaurant. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will help him educate his children and acquire properties for business purposes.

Wilfred sees more growth and business expansion within the next 5 years and hopes to acquire state of the art equipment to improve efficiency.

loans.use: boost working capital for his restaurant

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with seven children, 3 have graduated from school while 4 still attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
 
For the past 7 years,  Mwanakombo has been operating a street food stall business.  She sells at the market to her neighbors  and passersby.  Mwanakombo faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She dreams of owning a business premise in the future.

With this loan for 40,000 Kshs, Mwanakombo want to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy flour and rice

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with 7 children, 3 have graduated from school while 4 still attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 10 years, Mwanamisi has been operating a poultry business, selling her products from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also operates a fresh water selling business, which contributes as her other source of income.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a big supplier of poultry products and also wants to incorporates other products like fish in the future.

With this loan for 20,000 Kshs, Mwanamisi wants to purchase a water pump for her water distribution business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy a water pump

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with four sons, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Florence has been operating a street food business for the past 10 years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also sells charcoal to add to her income.  Florence faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season, it becomes difficult for her to operate her business. She dreams of becoming self-sufficient in the future.

With this loan for 20,000 Kshs, Mwanamisi wants to purchase 40 sacks charcoal to resell. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy 40 sacks charcoal

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with four school-going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees. 

For the past 5 years, Lydia has been operating a retail shop business, selling household consumables like sugar, tea leaves, maize flour, wheat flour and rice. In addition, she also supplies fresh milk, which contributes as her other source of income. 

With this loan for 20,000 KES, Lydia wants to repair her freezer to store fresh milk for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: repair her freezer

loans.name: Abduabos

texts.en:
Abduabos is a hardworking man who is married and has four children. He is engaged in animal husbandry. Abduabos sells cattle and sheep as well as provides transportation services.  He buys livestock and feeds them for a certain period to fatten them up then sells them. His wife helps him in this business. In addition to this business, he also cultivates vegetables such as potatoes and wheat. Abduabos would like to get a loan of 6,000 TJS to purchase more sheep to expand his animal sales business. With the profit he will make, he plans improve his living conditions. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buy more sheep

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a married woman with three children. Julita has been working as a farmer in the Philippines for 10 years.

Julita is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizers to make her crop more productive and to pay for laborers who help her work on the rice farm. She hopes this loan will grow her operations. Currently, Julita earns PHP 30,000 each cropping in this field of work.

In the future, Julita hopes to make her crop more productive in order to generate more income and make her family more economically stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay for laborers

loans.name: Mwanafuraha

texts.en:
Mwanafuraha is a married woman with 5 children, 2 of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Mwanafuraha has been operating a grocery selling business where she sells vegetables and fruits to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also operates a charcoal selling business, which contributes as her other source of income. 

Mwanafuraha faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the dry hot season, the availability of vegetables and fruits is minimal and the demand is high, while during the cold rainy season the availability of green grocery is high in supply and demand is low. She dreams of becoming self-reliant in her business in the future.

With this loan for 30,000 Kshs, Mwanafuraha wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Davlat

texts.en:
Davlat is a responsible husband and loving father of three children. He lives with his family in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. Davlat sells women’s shoes in the market of Istaravshan. He services his clients with joy and pleasure. Davlat has been running this business for 10 years and has many regular clients.  Davlat has requested a loan of 4500 TJS to purchase new assortments of women’s shoes in order to attract new clients. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buy new assortments of women's shoes

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a married man and has one child who is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent.

For the past 4 years, Kenneth has been operating a computer shop, where he repairs computers. His potential customers are cyber cafe operators. He faces a major challenge in high competition and the high cost of purchasing spare parts. Kenneth dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With this loan for 60,000 Kshs, Kenneth wants to purchase computer spare parts for his shop. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: buy computer spare parts

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is a married woman with four children. She is 45 years old and has had a food selling business for 15 years. Myrna sells fruits and vegetables to the people in her community and she earns approximately PHP 5,000 monthly. She is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase more vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbages, squash, onions and garlic to generate more income. In the future, Myrna hopes to have a big business, achieve financial independence and provide progressive living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbages, squash, onions and garlic.

loans.name: Nehemiah

texts.en:
Nehemiah is 33 years old.  He is married and has 4 children between 2 and 9 years old. Three of his children are currently attending school.  

Nehemiah is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where he has been farming for 5 years. He employs one farmhand and sells his eggs, maize, beans and bananas to the local market. He also earns income from his motorcycle transport business.
 
Nehemiah has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo after he recently repaid his third loan of 70,000 Kes. He has requested a new loan of 70,000 Kes in order to buy additional stock of poultry and construct a poultry house. He says that this loan will help him expand his poultry farm, which will mean increased production of eggs and income. 

Nehemiah's biggest challenge in his business has been diseases, which causes massive poultry death.   He plans to expand his farming activities in the future and be able to dominate the local market with his supply of eggs.

loans.use: buy poultry and construct a poultry house

loans.name: Sabri

texts.en: This borrower is from Iraq. He is 53 years old, married and has three children. He lives with six family members,who two of them work. Sabri has a food market and photocopier machine since 2009. He has a long experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area. He is requesting a $1500 loan to purchase more goods for his store like cheese, beverages, sweets and dairy products. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for his store like cheese, beverages, sweets and dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Barnokhon

texts.en:
Barnokhon is 38 years old. She is married and has three children. Barnokhon is engaged in an animal husbandry and has been running this business for 8 years.  She also grows apricots. Currently, her husband is working in Russia and sends his family 200-300 USD every month. Barnokhon would like to get a loan of 5,400 TJS to expand her land for apricot farming.  She has received 2 cycles of loans from Imon International and has a good credit history.
    
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buy an apricot garden

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 61 years old.  She is widowed and is a mother of 9 children, aged between 5 and 43. Three of her children are currently attending school.

Agnes has a mixed farm in Kitale town in western Kenya which produces sorghum, millet, potatoes, maize, milk and beans. She has been in the farming business for 20 years now and employs two farmhands. She mainly depends on the income from her farm to cater for the needs of her family.

Agnes has requested this loan of 52,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from this project will enable her to pay school fees for her children. She says that during the dry season, animal feeds are expensive and this has posed a challenge to her dairy farm. In the future, she plans to acquire 3 high-bred dairy cows to increase her milk productivity.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 55 years old and married with three children. Wilson is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns PHP 35,000 per harvest. Wilson is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides in order to gain a better yield. Wilson raises crops. He has been primarily planting and harvesting rice for 19 years. In the future, Wilson hopes to generate more earnings in order to continuously send his children to school and assure them of a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Parvana

texts.ru:
Parvana 43 qoda. Ona zamujem imeyet 2 detey. Parvana yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim mujem i dvuma ochen umnimi,poslushnimi detmi. 
Parvana zanimayetsya pechkoy nacionalnoqo xleba "Tandir" uje 8 let. Ona s malix let uchilas u svoyey mami kak ispech samiy vkusniye "Tandir". Parvana dolgo ne zanimalas etim delom tak kak ona vishla zamuj i u neyo rodilis deti, no koqda yeyo deti uje podrosli ona reshila nachat ispekat "Tandir" chtobi uludshit yejemesachniy doxod semyi.  Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye produkti(muka,razrixlitel, moloko i t.d)dlya toqo chtobi pech "Tandir".
texts.en:
Parvana is 43 years old. She is married and has two children. Parvana is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her husband and her two smart, obedient children.  
 
Parvana has been baking the traditional bread called "tandir" for eight years.  From a very young age, she learned from her mother how to bake the most delicious tandir.  Parvana did not bake for a long time after she married and had children. but after her children got older, she decided to start baking tandir again to bring in additional income for the family.  Now she needs 2000 AZN to buy necessary ingredients (such as flour, leavening agents, milk, etc.) to bake tandir.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to bake bread.

loans.name: Jafether

texts.en:
Jafether has been practicing mixed farming in his hometown of Kitale in western Kenya for 7 years now. He employs one farmhand and sells his products of milk, eggs and maize to middlemen. He earns additional income from his hotel business in the same location.

Jafether has made a loan request of 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with the dairy cow he will acquire, his family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption as well as for sale. The proceeds from the sale of milk will go towards the education of his children.  Jafether's biggest challenge in this business has been diseases which affect his production. He would like to have at least 3 quality dairy cows and a motorcycle in the next 5 years.

Jafether is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children aged between 8 and 17. Two of his children attend school.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 17 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Sharon has a clothing sales business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Sharon has requested a loan of 450,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Sharon hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Sharon is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her job skills such as tailoring.

loans.name: Lutfullo

texts.en:
Lutfullo is an active 37-year-old and the father of three children. His wife is a housewife. Lutfullo has been in the farming business for 10 years, and is helped by his older son. In their spare time, they make raw bricks. Lutfullo has requested a loan of 6,300 TJS to increase his harvest and number of cattle. With the profits he will make, he plans to build a house and educate his children. Let’s help him with this purchase.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and cattle.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 34 years old.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children who all attend school. She is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where she has been farming for 5 years now. She employs one farmhand and sells her milk, tomatoes and eggs to the local market. 

Janet has requested a loan of 31,200 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help improve her family's lifestyle. Her biggest challenge in this business has been lack of enough animal feeds, especially during the dry season. She plans to have 5 dairy cows and a posho mill in the next 5 years.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married woman with 2 children  – 1 attends school while the other is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Sofia has been operating a food stall business for the past 7 years, selling from home to her neighbours and school-going children. Sofia faces a major challenge in price fluctuations, preventing her from meeting customer demands. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With this loan for 10,000 Kshs, Sofia wants to purchase bundles of rice, beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy rice, beans and wheat flour

loans.name: Maombi Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Bushashire est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire « Maombi »,  âgée de 48 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants. Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans leur petit projet de business.  La cliente est vendeuse de sticks d’arbre (bois). Elle est aussi propriétaire d’un kiosque pour le petit commerce de divers  Il ya plus de 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle vient de réaliser 14 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Elle démarra son business avec  30 $ reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  les articles divers de son kiosque ( 1 carton de savon, 1 carton de bombons, 50 kg de sucré,  lotion de beauté, Omo, les alinettes, brosse à dent, etc.) à marchander.  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et construire un bloc de maison à mettre à location.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Maombi» est majoritairement féminin.
texts.en:
Bushashire is an entrepreneur, and leader of the Maombi business group, which consists mostly of women. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She and her husband support each other in running their small business. She sells firewood, and she also owns a kiosk where she sells sundries. She has been doing this for over 10 years. 

Bushashire has just completed her 14th loan cycle with the Hekima MFI. She originally started her business with a sum of $30 received from her husband. 

This new loan will serve to stock up on merchandise for her kiosk (1 carton of soap, 1 box of candy, 50 kg of sugar, some lotion, some Omo detergent, matches, toothbrushes, etc.). She plans to expand her business, send her children to school, and build a block of houses for leasing. 

The client Bushashire wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping the less fortunate who do not have access to traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy 1 carton of soap, 1 box of candy, 50 kg of sugar, some lotion, some Omo detergent, matches, toothbrushes, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Freddy Gilbert

texts.es:
Freddy Gilbert tiene 40 años, vive en union libre vive con la compañera y un hijo de 8 años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL RECREO se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol y soya.

freddy se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y frejol en terrenos de propios , las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar una maquina desgranadora para el grano.

le gusta hacer deporte y festejar las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en: Freddy Gilbert is 40 and lives with his wife and son, who is 8, in Ventanas, Rios province.  He is a member of V.R.C. EL RECREO in San Vicente de las Lomas, whose members are farmers growing corn, rice, beans and soy.  Freddy specializes in growing corn and beans on his property, which he sells in local markets, especially on Sundays.  He is seeking this credit to buy crop seed and fertilizer, to meet his needs and help him to overcome challenges such as variable rainfall. His dream is to one day buy a machine to de-husk grain.

loans.use: to buy crop seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana is 53 years old. She has 11 children between the ages of 23 and 40 years old. She is a very hard working mother and she works with her husband. She sells locally made alcohol, made out of sorghum(the brown grains on the ground) and bananas. She has done this business for 6 years and her business is going on well. She is requesting a loan to buy sorghum and green bananas to make the beer.

loans.use: to purchase sorghum and green bananas.

loans.name: Adele

texts.en:
Adele is 45 years old. She has 4 children who are between the ages  of 9 and 19years old. All of her children are in school. Her husband is a farmer. Adele sells clothes in the market and she has been selling clothes for the past 14 years. She sells shirts, trousers, sweaters and vests. This business has enabled her to meet her needs and to pay fees for her children.

Adele is requesting a loan to buy more clothes in order to make profits.She plans to make some savings and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow and purchase additional stock of chickens.

loans.name: Juan Ronald

texts.es:
Juan Ronald tiene 24 años, Es soltero vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL RECREO se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol y soya.

Juan Ronald se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz, arroz y soya en terrenos de los padres, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando en la tierrra y comprar terreno por le gusta mucho trabajar en la tierra.
texts.en:
Juan Ronald is 24, single, and he lives with his parents in the Ventanas province, de los Rios province.

The members of the V.R. C. El Recreo group are located in Ventanas canton, in the precint of San Vicente de las Loma.  This rural group is made up of  farmers of crops with a short turnaround-they grow corn, rice, beans and soybeans.

Juan Ronald grows corn, rice and soybeans on his parents’ land.  He buys supplies in Ventanas and sells the crops in the daily markets but especially on Sundays.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure and the financing will help him take care of his needs.  He has problems with competition and the changes in climate.  His dream is to continue working on the farm and to buy his own field since he really enjoys working the land.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati, 30 years old, is married with 3 children aged between 6 months and 8 years old. She sells clothes for children and elders. Her business is well-organized and she has 3 years of experience in it. Bahati works from 7:00 a.m. until 6.30 p.m. every day except Sunday. 

Bahati has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothing to sell. She will reinvest any profit earned in her business and she will be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Celia Jenny

texts.es:
Celia Jenny tiene 41 años, Es viudad vive con un hijo de 13 años que esta en el colegio viven en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL RECREO se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol y soya.

Celia se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz, arroz y soya en terrenos de los padres, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es que laproduccion aumente para tener mas ingresos y poder mantener a su hijo.

Le gusta mucho escuchar usica y salir con su hijo.
texts.en:
Celia Jenny, age 41, is a widow who lives with her 13-year-old son, who is in school.  They live in Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Rios.

The communal group "EL RECREO" is located in Ventanas Canton in the San Vicente sector of Las Lomas.  This group is involved in farm activity, raising short-cycle crops such as corn, rice, beans and soy.

Celia grows corn, rice and soy on her parents' land.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas and sells at the fair every day, especially on Sunday.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  The loan will help her economically to cover her needs.  Her greatest challenges are the competition and weather variation.  Her dream is to increase production so she can increase income and support her son.

She enjoys listening to music and going out with her son.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a married woman with 10 children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 1 year, she has operated a business selling firewood from home to her neighbors and passersby. She also owns a retail shop which contributes to her income. She faces a major challenge  in her business with the high cost of transportation.

With the Kshs 20,000 she has requested, Kibibi plans to pay school fees and also purchase more stock of firewood for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To pay school fees and also purchase firewood for sale.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en: Jean Bosco is 36 years old.  He has 5 children who are between 2 and 15 years old.  All except the youngest are in school.  Jean Bosco owns a store in which he sells foodstuffs such as beans, sugar, and cooking oil.  He has been doing this business for 8 years, and from this business he has been able to meet the needs of his family.  He is requesting a loan to buy items such as toilet paper, soap, sugar, etc. to fill his store and make more profits.  He intends to save the additional profits.

loans.use: to buy items such as toilet paper, soap, sugar, etc. for his shop.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is 61 years old and married with 13 children aged between 18 and 36, two of whom are currently attending school. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years in his hometown of Kitale in western Kenya. He employs one farmhand and sells his produce of milk, maize, and beans to the local market. He also depends on his pension pay to cater for the needs of his family.

Sammy has made a loan request of 51,600 Kes from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow and buy additional stock of chickens. The income from these projects will help him meet the family's expenses. In the future, he would like to acquire two more dairy cows that will help improve his milk production. He faces the challenge of unpredictable weather conditions which makes it difficult to find enough animal feed, especially during the dry spell.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and buy additional stock of chickens.

loans.name: Mariuxi Yesenia

texts.es:
Mariuxi Yesenia tiene 30 años, vive en union libre con el compañero y un hijo de 8 años que se llama Dannia en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL RECREO se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol y soya.

Mariuxi se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz, arroz y soya en terrenos de los padres, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es que el negocio cresca para tener ingresos para no pasar necesidades.

Le gusta bailar y salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Mariuxi Yesenia, age 30, lives with her common-law partner and 8-year-old son named Dannia in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Rios.

The communal bank "EL RECREO" is located in Ventanas Canton in the San Vicente sector of Las Lomas.  This group is involved in farm activity, growing short-cycle crops such as corn, rice, beans and soy.

Mariuxi grows corn, rice and soy on her parents' land.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas and sells at the fairs every day, especially on Sunday.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  The loan will help her economically to cover her expenses.  Her greatest challenges are the competition and weather variation.  Her dream is to grow her business to increase income so she does not have to go without basic needs.

She likes to dance and go out for walks with her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Slyvan

texts.en:
Slyvan is 52 years old.  He has 7 children, who are between the ages of 2 and 28 years old.  His wife sells foodstuffs in the market.

Slyvan has a hardware shop.  His stock includes spare bicycle and motorcycle parts.  He has done this business for 15 years and everything is going well.  This business has enabled him to pay school fees for his children and to make some savings.  He is requesting a loan to buy more spare parts in order to increase his profits.  He plans to save the additional profits and buy a motorcycle in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: G.s. En Nombre De Jesus Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario En Nombre De Jesús está conformado por Johana Maria y Margarita Esperanza. Johana se dedica a la venta de quesillos, tiene más de 4 años de tener este negocio inicio desde muy joven ya que su mama, se dedicaba a este tipo de actividad y fue más adelante que Johana decide encargarse del negocio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de cuajada, cebolla, vinagre, bolsas plásticas y otros productos. Sueña con establecer un kiosco en la escuela donde ofrece sus productos.
texts.en:
The support group "En Nombre de Jesús" is comprised of Johana María and Margarita Esperanza.  Johana has been selling cheese for over four years.  She got involved in the activity when she was young because her mother did the same thing for a living, and later Johana decided to take over the business.

The loan is to buy curd, onion, vinegar, plastic bags and other products.  Her dream is to set up a kiosk at the school so she can offer her products there.

loans.use: To buy curd, onion, vinegar, plastic bags and other products.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 68 years old. She has 6 children who are between the ages of 28 and 37 years old. She is a widow and she has always taken care of her children. She sells different kinds of food stuffs and she has been selling food stuffs for the past 12 years. Her business is moving on well. She is requesting a loan to buy more food items such as beans, sorghum, wheat flour, etc.

loans.use: to purchase food items.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia, 24 years old, is married with a 2-year-old child. She has been operating a beauty salon for one year. Her business is well-organized. Claudia works from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. every day and employs three people to help her.
