Desde su niñez ha desarrollado las habilidades para desempeñarse como un buen agricultor y hoy que tiene una familia recién formada, por lo que siente la responsabilidad de sostener su hogar como padre de familia. Por ello tiene terrenos que le fue heredado, ahí siembra papa. Del mismo modo, también cría 20 carneros  2 vacas  y 4 cerdos que tiene en su establo y del que son vendidos de manera periódica y de acuerdo a sus necesidades económicas mientras espera el tiempo de la cosecha. En esta actividad su esposa es quien más la apoya y ambos tienen el anhelo de tener su propia casa  con buena infraestructura para dar una mejor calidad de vidad para su familia. Este será su crédito número 3 con MFP, manifiesta que le agrada trabajar en su banco comunal porque  tiene una oportunidad de crecimiento para su actividad agrícola. Además renueva su compromiso de ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y en el pago de la preparación de terreno con yunta para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Semion is 25 years old. He lives with his wife and their 3 year-old daughter in his parents’ house. Since he was a boy, he has developed his abilities as a good farmer. Now he has a family and he feels the responsibility of providing for his household as a father and husband. 

He has land that he inherited and he cultivates potatoes there. He is also raising 20 rams [sheep], 2 cows, and 4 pigs in his stable. He sells them periodically, according to his economic needs, while awaiting the harvest. His wife is the person who helps him the most and both want to have their own house with good infrastructure, so they can give the best quality of life to their family. 

This will be his 3rd loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. He says he likes working with his communal bank because he has the opportunity to grow his agricultural business. He also renews his promise to be punctual in his repayments. With the loan he is requesting, he will buy bags of fertilizer and also pay to prepare his land with a team of oxen before he plants his next crop.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and to hire laborers to help him prepare his land for the next planting.

loans.name: Tautega

texts.en:
Tautega is 40 years of age and married with three children (aged 15-18 years). Tautega owns a business making and selling cup-cakes for sale. She has one year of experience in this business. Tautega needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, baking powder, and sugar needed to make her cup-cakes.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 260 talas or US $108 per week) to financially support members of her immediate family.

In 2011, Tautega joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Tautega's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, baking powder and sugar needed to make cup-cakes for sale

loans.name: Graciela Concepción

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 46 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos. Estudio  hasta  3ro de secundaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, su préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de artesanía como bordados, venta de granos de la región y frutas, cuenta que los bordados los lleva a la Isla los Uros y a la localidad de Juli.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles comprará diez sacos de papa. En el negocio trabaja junto con su esposo quien es albañil.
Su sueño es mejorar su casa para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y dice que los préstamos de Manuela le dan suerte.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of "3 de Mayo" community bank, located in Ilave district in the province of El Collao and the department of Puno. She is 46 years old and lives with her husband and her four children. Graciela completed formal education through the third year of secondary school.

She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she invested in her grocery business. Graciela is now selling hand-embroidered textiles, staple grains and fruit. She travels to Isla los Uros and Juli to sell the embroidery.

With this loan of 1,000 PEN, Graciela will buy ten sacks of potatoes. She and her husband, a construction worker, work together in business activities. Graciela's dream is to improve her house for better quality of life. She likes attending the bank's meetings and says the loans from Movimiento Manuela Ramos bring her good luck.

loans.use: To buy ten sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Rosa Celestina

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por la parroquia de Chiquintad, lugar en donde su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y al comercio, mucha de su población labora en la ciudad en diferentes áreas.
 
La Señora. Rosa tiene 51 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 31, 29, 27, 24 y 19 años de edad, su primer hijo es soltero y vive independiente, sus tres hijos siguientes son casados e independiente, su último hijo es soltero, trabaja y le ayuda economícamente. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa.
 
Doña Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de Hebalife, actividad que la desempeña hace 2 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo y sin un horario fijo.

Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos naturales de Hrvalife para incrementar su negocio.

Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Mujeres Floreciendo” (Women in Bloom) communal bank.  She lives near Chiquintad Parish, a place where residents raise animals, farm and are merchants.  Many of its residents work in the city in different jobs.

Rosa is 51 years old, married and has five children who are 31, 29, 27, 24 and 19 years of age.  Her oldest son is single and lives independently.  The next three children are married and independent and the youngest is single, employed and helps her economically.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  Their joint efforts have made the construction of their house possible.

Rosa sells Herbalife natural products, an activity she’s been in for two years.  She works Sunday through Sunday with no fixed schedule.

This is the third loan she’s taken in the communal bank which she was invited to join by a friend.  She will use the money to buy Herbalife natural products to increase her business.  Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: Comprar productos naturales de Hervalife.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo en su casa que es propia. Hace más de 5 años que posee una tienda, negocio que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, desde entonces se dedica a diario a su tienda, recibiendo ay complaciendo a los clientes sobre el producto que deseen llevar. Por ello procura siempre abastecer su negocio, además cuanta con proveedores que mensualmente le hace algún pedio por tal producto. Los tiempos en que mejor vende son los días festivos, como por ejemplo, las fiestas patrias, navidad  o cuando es temporada escolar, por tal compra los productos que tiene mayor demanda para esas fechas. Este será su crédito número 12 con MFP, considera que cada crédito le ayudó a mejorar su negocio por lo cual esta muy agradecida. Ahora desea que le ayuden con otro aporte económico para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Victoria, 53, lives with her husband in their own home. For more than 5 years she has had a store located in their home. During that time she has worked daily in her store, receiving her customers and meeting their needs with the products they want. For that reason she tries to always have her store stocked. She also has customers that ask for certain products every month. She sells the most during holidays, like national festivals, Christmas or the school season - she buys products according to demand during those seasons. 

This will be her 12th loan with MFP. She believes that each loan helped her to improve her business and is very thankful for that. Now she wants additional economic support to help solidify her plans. With the loan requested, she will invest in buying products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal “3 D. Mayo” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento D. Puno, tiene 70 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 6 hijos (5 independientes).  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
DesD. hace tres años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial D.  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles lo invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. abarrotes.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles comprará galletas, leche, aceite, conservas, fideos, huevo,  gaseosas, etc.  En el negocio trabaja sola.
Su sueño es mejorar su tienda y así mejorar también sus ingresos.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the 3rd of May Communal Bank located in the Llave district, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 70 years old, a widow and has 6 children (5 are independent). She has no formal education.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years, and her first loan was of S/. 500.00 nuevos soles that were used for her grocery store.

With this new loan of S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles Alejandrina will buy cookies, milk, oil, preserves, spaghetti, eggs, refreshments, etc. She works alone in her store.

Alejandrina’s dream is to improve her store as well as her earnings.

What she enjoys about her Communal Bank are the meetings and the ease of acquiring the loans.

loans.use: buy cookies, milk, oil, preserves, spaghetti, eggs, refreshments, etc.

loans.name: Julia Adriana

texts.es:
La Señorita. Julia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por la parroquia de Paccha, lugar en donde su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y elaboración de artesanías, mucha de su población labora en la ciudad en diferentes áreas.
 
La Señorita. Julia es soltera, tiene de 22 años de edad y vive con sus padres, su papá se dedica a la sastrería y su mamá a la agricultura. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Nuestra socia está estudiando en una universidad de la ciudad, cursa el quinto año de derecho. Hace un mes se dedica a la venta de productos Avon.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para su negocio, es socia del banco comunal hace un año.
 
Su meta es culminar con éxito sus estudios.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the "Mujeres Floreciendo" (Flourishing Women) community bank.  She lives in Paccha parish where people raise animals, farm and make handicrafts.  Many locals are engaged in different lines of work in the city.

Julia is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents.  Her dad is a tailor and her mom is a farmer.  They do not own their own home but rent instead.

Julia is studying at a university in the city.  She is in her fifth year of a law degree.  For one month she has been selling Avon products.

Julia will invest her new loan in buying cosmetics for her business.  She has been a member of her community bank for one year.

Julia's goal is to successfully finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy Avon products

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Alfonso solicita un préstamo para comprar material D. construcción ya que le esta haciendo falta un cuarto y en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el block, arena y cemente que es el material que le esta haciendo falta para empezar L. construcción. 

Pagar el crédito con el ingreso que recibe D. su trabajo como empleado D. L. ciudad oficial administrativo, y su esposa L. señora Aurelia se encargara D. los gastos familiares en el sueldo que recibe D. su trabajo en una fabrica.
Desean que sus dos hijos tengan su propio espacio en L. casa.
texts.en:
Alfonso is requesting a loan to buy construction material because he needs a room.  At this time he does not have the money he needs to buy the block, sand, and cement; which is the material needed to start the construction.

He will pay back the loan with the income he gets from his work.  He is employed as a city administrative officer.  His wife, Aurelia, handles the family expenses with the salary she receives working in a factory.

They want their two children to have their own space in the house.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Cruz Carmelina

texts.es:
La Señora. Cruz es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por la parroquia de Paccha, lugar en donde su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y elaboración de artesanías, mucha de su población labora en la ciudad en diferentes áreas.
 
La Señora. Cruz tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad, su primer hijo es  casado e independiente, su segundo hijo esta estudiando en el colegio, trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. Su esposo labora prestando sus servicios como guardia de seguridad, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Cruz se dedica a la venta de bocaditos de dulce, a la venta de ropa y también cría pollo a los que los vende pelados a sus clientes. Todos sus productos los vende recorriendo la ciudad.

 En el banco comunal esta hace 8 años y todos los créditos le han beneficiado en sus negocios. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, ropa y bocaditos de dulce.

Su sueño es viajar a las Estados Unidos de America.
texts.en:
Cruz is a member of the “Mujeres Floreciendo” (Women in Bloom) communal bank.  She lives around Paccha Parish whose residents raise animals, farm and make crafts.  Many of its residents work in the city in various jobs.

Cruz is 56 years old and has two adult children.  Her oldest son is married and independent and her second son is in high school, employed and helps her economically.  Her husband works providing security guard services.  Their joint effort has led to the construction of their house.

Cruz sells sweet snacks, clothes and she also raises chickens to sell dressed to her customers.  She sells all her products as a street vendor throughout the city.

She’s been in the communal bank for 8 years and all the loans have benefitted her business.  The new loan will be used to buy chickens, clothes and sweet snacks.  Her dream is to travel to the United States of America.

loans.use: to buy clothes, chickens and sweet snacks.

loans.name: Sergio J Dolores

texts.es:
El señor Sergio tiene más de 11 años dedicándose a la albañilería, trabajo con el cual mantiene a su  esposa y a sus dos hijos, situación que no había sido un problema hasta que el señor Sergio se quedo sin herramienta de trabajo, por lo cual está solicitando un préstamo con nosotros para comprar dicha herramienta debido a que no cuenta con el capital para comprarlas  y no desea que por no poder adquirir nuevas herramientas de trabajo la estabilidad económica de la familia se venga abajo. Así que el señor Sergio con la nueva herramienta que desea adquirir piensa hacer más trabajos de albañilería al mes para generar más ingresos para la familia así como también para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Debido a esto él se compromete a pagar este crédito con sus ingresos como albañil en el tiempo acordado.
texts.en:
Sergio has been working as a bricklayer for over 11 years; he supports his wife and two children with this work.  This situation hadn’t been a problem until he found himself without any work tools.  

This is why he’s asking for a loan to buy tools because he does not have the capital needed to buy them and he doesn’t want his family’s economic stability to crumble for lack of tools with which to work.  Sergio plans to use the tools he intends to get to do more bricklaying work per month to generate more family income as well as to provide a better quality of life for his family.  

Because of this he commits to repay the loan with his income as a bricklayer in the agreed upon time frame.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Blanca le esta haciendo falta las protecciones en las ventas y puertas de su casa.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para pagarle a la persona que se encargara de elaborar  y colocar la protecciones, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagarle y le preocupa la seguridad de su familia. 
Dona Blanca trabaja en una restauran de mesera y con ese ingreso pagara el crédito y que su esposo el señor Victor se encargara de los gastos familiares y escalares de sus dos hijos que tiene.
texts.en:
Blanca needs protections on the windows and doors to her house.  She is requesting a loan to pay a person to make and install the protections.

At this time she does not have the money needed to pay for it, and she worries about her family’s security.

Blanca works as a waitress at a restaurant, and she will use this income to pay back the loan.  Her husband, Victor, will take charge of paying the family expenses and the school expenses for their two children.

loans.use: to install protection on the windows and doors.

loans.name: Maota

texts.en:
Maota is 53 years of age and a widow with five children. Maota owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has four years of experience in this business. Maota needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 320 talas or US $133 per week) to financially support her family.

In 2011, Maota joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Maota's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva is 40 years of age and married with four children. She owns a business selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap. and toothpaste.  She has three years of experience in this business. Melva needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional stocks for her store. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 120 talas or US $50 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2011, Melva joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Melva's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her store

loans.name: Hinemoa

texts.en:
Hinemoa is 57 years of age and married with three children. Hinemoa is starting a business venture, selling to the local community  baked food such as pudding, cupcakes and pineapple pie. Hinemoa needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale, such as baking powder, sacks of flour, sacks of sugar and some flavoring.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or US $63 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Hinemoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Hinemoa's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale, such as baking powder, sacks of flour, sacks of sugar and some flavorings

loans.name: Fenumiai

texts.en:
Fenumiai is 58 years old.  She is married and has six children. Fenumiai owns & operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  She has 6 years of experience in this business. Fenumiai needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit generated (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2006, Fenumiai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fenumiai's 8th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Faima

texts.en:
Faima is 27 years of age.  She is married and has four children. Faima owns & operates a clothing business selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  She has 3 years of experience in this business. 

Faima needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the profit generated (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Faima joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Faima's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: purchase fabrics & clothing materials

loans.name: Rarotonga

texts.en:
Rarotonga is 23 years of age.  She is married and has three children. Rarotonga owns & operates a general store selling food products in the local community.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  

Rarotonga needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell and to fill in the available shelves in her shop.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Rarotonga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Rarotonga's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: purchase products to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is from the village of Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 45 years old, married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried goods. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sasa

texts.en:
Sasa is 24 years of age and married with one child. Sasa owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 3 years of experience in this business. Sasa needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao is a hard-working woman who has spent her life cultivating crops for ten years in Kompong Cham Province. She learned this skill from her grandparents when she was single. Every year, she plants her rice crop at least twice a year, rainy season and dry season, and she can make a profit around US$ 2 per day. In order to generate more income, Mrs. Mao’s husband is employed as a construction worker in the field and earning about $2 a day. They have three children; one is a former construction worker while the other two are still enrolled in school. 

Mrs. Mao will be using her loan to mend her old house because most parts of it are broken. She wants to repair it, but she doesn’t have sufficient money to do that. This is the reason why she is seeking a Kiva loan. Mrs. Mao is pictured in the photo with her husband in front of their house.

texts.en:
